item.title: Cops nab murder suspect who evaded arrest for 8 years
item.content:encoded:
construction worker, arrest, Rizal, murder, 2016 Summary: A construction worker who had been on the run for eight years was finally apprehended in Rizal for two counts of murder in 2016. The worker had managed to evade capture until recently, when authorities were able to track him down and bring him to justice. The crimes in question took place back in 2016, but the suspect had managed to avoid arrest for an extended period. The arrest of the worker marks a significant breakthrough in the case, providing closure for the families of the victims. The construction worker now faces two counts of murder charges and will have to stand trial for his alleged crimes. The capture of the suspect serves as a reminder that justice may be delayed, but it will eventually catch up with those who seek to evade it. The authorities' persistence in tracking down the fugitive showcases their commitment to upholding the law and ensuring that those responsible for heinous crimes are held accountable for their actions. The arrest is a significant milestone in bringing closure to a long-standing case and delivering justice to the victims and their families.

Summary:

After eight years of evading arrest, a construction worker was nabbed in Rizal for two counts of murder in 2016.

item.title: DOTr mulls raps vs. protesters of PUV modernization
item.content:encoded:
protesters, transport strike, government, PUV modernization program, complaints Summary: The Department of Transportation (DOTr) announced that protesters who participated in the two-day transport strike, protesting against the government's PUV modernization program, may face complaints for causing inconvenience to the public. The strike was organized to express opposition to the implementation of the program, which aims to modernize public utility vehicles. The DOTr highlighted that the protesters' actions had disrupted public transportation services and inconvenienced commuters. The government has emphasized the benefits of the modernization program, including improved safety standards and more reliable transportation services. However, protesters remain adamant in their resistance to the program, citing concerns about its impact on drivers and operators. Despite the backlash from protesters, the DOTr continues to push for the modernization of PUVs to address issues such as road safety and environmental sustainability.

Protesters who joined the two-day transport strike rejecting the implementation of the government's public utility vehicle (PUV) modernization program may face complaints for inconveniencing the public, the Department of Transportation (DOTr) on Tuesday said.

item.title: Bangkay ng babae na hinihinalang pinagsamantalahan, nakita sa Pangasinan
item.content:encoded: Isang duguang bangkay ng babae ang nakita sa bakanteng lote sa Bautista, Pangasinan.

item.title: PNP official denies any affiliation with name-dropping EDSA Busway violator
item.content:encoded: The police official whose name was mentioned by a female motorist after she was caught for using the EDSA Busway denied he knew the woman and wants to file charges against her.

item.title: Marcos orders DOE to address power situation
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on Tuesday ordered the Department of Energy (DOE) to address the energy situation in the country following the red alert declaration of the National Grid Corporation of the Philippines (NGCP).

item.title: Spire collapses as fire engulfs Copenhagen"s historic stock exchange
item.content:encoded: A fire ripped through Copenhagen's Old Stock Exchange, one of the Danish capital's best-known buildings, on Tuesday, engulfing its spire which collapsed.

item.title: PCG to join 2024 Balikatan Exercise
item.content:encoded: In a historic first, the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) will join the 2024 Balikatan Exercise between the Philippines and the US.

item.title: Guro, 'di alintana ang peligro sa paglalayag sa Sorsogon Bay makapagturo lang sa mga bata sa isang isla
item.content:encoded: Mag-isang pinapaandar ng isang guro ang bangka na kaniyang sinasakyan upang makatawid sa Sorsogon Bay at marating ang isang isla kung saan naghihintay ang kaniyang mga estudyante. Hindi niya alintana ang peligro ng dagat magampanan lang ang kaniyang tungkulin bilang isang maestra.

item.title: 3 kids drown in Davao City
item.content:encoded: Three minors died of drowning in the town of Agdao, Davao City.  An initial investigation showed the victims -- aged 7,4, and 7 -- were last seen playing along the shorelines of North San Juan in Barangay Centro on Saturday afternoon. However, their parents noticed they failed to come home, prompting them to report that the minor victims were missing.

item.title: Israel still imposing 'unlawful" restrictions on Gaza aid --UN human rights office
item.content:encoded: Israel is still imposing "unlawful" restrictions on humanitarian relief for Gaza, the UN Human Rights Office said on Tuesday, despite assertions from Israel and others that barriers have eased.

item.title: 7-year-old allegedly raped by brother, cousin, uncle in Marikina
item.content:encoded: Police arrested a 19-year-old man in Marikina City after he and two other male relatives allegedly raped his 7-year-old sister.

item.title: Senate bill vs. unauthorized use of wang-wang, blinkers filed
item.content:encoded:
proposed measure, Philippine roads, emergency lights, audio accessories, motor vehicles Summary:

A proposed measure in the Philippines aims to prohibit the indiscriminate use of emergency lights and audio accessories on motor vehicles. The goal is to protect the lives of commuters and drivers while also preventing misuse by public officials. This measure is crucial for enhancing road safety and ensuring that emergency lights are used appropriately for their intended purpose. The misuse of these accessories can create confusion on the roads and potentially lead to accidents. By regulating their use, authorities can better enforce traffic laws and maintain order on Philippine roads. This measure highlights the importance of responsible driving practices and emphasizes the need for strict guidelines to govern the use of emergency lights and audio accessories on vehicles. Overall, this proposed legislation seeks to promote safer roads and reduce the risk of accidents caused by the misuse of these features.

Summary:

Seeking to protect the lives of commuters and drivers while preventing misuse by public officials on Philippine roads, a proposed measure has been filed before the Senate prohibiting the indiscriminate use of emergency lights and audio accessories on motor vehicles.

item.title: Ama, pinatay sa saksak ang sarili niyang anak na babaeng 1-taong-gulang sa Bukidnon
item.content:encoded:
sanggol, babae, patayin, ama, Tikalaan
A one-year-old baby girl met a tragic end after being stabbed to death by her own father in Tikalaan, Bukidnon. The incident left the community in shock and disbelief as they struggled to come to terms with such a heinous act committed by a parent against his own child. The father's motive for the crime remains unclear, leaving many questioning how such a horrific act could take place. The infant's short life was cut short in a senseless act of violence that has left many reeling with grief and horror. The authorities have launched an investigation into the incident to bring justice for the innocent victim and ensure that the perpetrator faces the full extent of the law for his heinous actions. The community has come together to mourn the loss of the young child and offer support to the family in their time of need. Such a tragic and senseless act serves as a stark reminder of the importance of safeguarding the well-being of children and preventing such atrocities from happening again in the future.

Summary: - One-year-old baby girl - Tragic end after being stabbed by father - Incident in Tikalaan, Bukidnon - Father's motive unclear - Community in shock and mourning

Kalunos-lunos ang sinapit ng isang sanggol na babae na isang-taong-gulang matapos siyang patayin sa saksak ng sarili niyang ama sa Tikalaan, Bukidnon.

item.title: Chinese nationals nabbed for illegal firearms, attempted bribery in Taguig
item.content:encoded:
Chinese nationals, arrested, Taguig City, firearms, bribery
Summary:

Two Chinese nationals were apprehended in a high-end subdivision in Taguig City for possessing high-caliber firearms and attempting to bribe authorities. The suspects were caught with the illegal firearms inside the exclusive neighborhood, sparking concerns about public safety and the presence of such weapons in a residential area. The arrests highlight the ongoing issue of illegal firearms circulation and foreign nationals engaging in criminal activities in the country. Furthermore, the attempted bribery suggests an alarming disregard for the rule of law and the integrity of law enforcement officers. The incident serves as a reminder for heightened security measures and vigilance in monitoring suspicious activities within gated communities.

Two Chinese nationals were arrested inside an exclusive subdivision in Taguig City for the alleged possession of high-caliber firearms and attempted bribery .

item.title: House inquiry into apparent influx of Chinese students in Cagayan sought
item.content:encoded: A Cagayan congressman is seeking a House inquiry into an apparent increase in Chinese students in the province, saying their presence could put the country"s security at risk amid China's aggression in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Villanueva: 'Gentleman"s agreement' is Chinese propaganda
item.content:encoded: Senator Joel Villanueva said the revelation of the "gentleman"s agreement" between former President Rodrigo Duterte and China was propaganda meant to divide the country.

item.title: Incentives, loans for small solar power users eyed
item.content:encoded: A bill granting incentives and credit facilities for consumers of small solar power systems in the Philippines has been filed in the House of Representatives.

item.title: Halaga ng piso kontra US dollar, humina sa P57-$1
item.content:encoded: Patuloy ang paghina ng halaga ng piso kontra sa US dollar na pumalo sa P57:$1 nitong Martes, na pinakamababa sa nakalipas na halos isa't kalahating taon.

item.title: Defense chief: AFP won't heed calls to withdraw support for Marcos
item.content:encoded: Calls for the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) to withdraw support from President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. are "futile" and will only lead to a "possible criminal investigation," Defense Secretary Gilberto Teodoro Jr. said.

item.title: PNP: Biggest drug haul came from 'different source'
item.content:encoded: The P13.3 billion worth of shabu seized in Batangas came from a different source compared to the illegal drugs confiscated in previous operations.

item.title: 4 na Pinoy seafarers na sakay ng barkong kinubkob ng Iran, pakakawan--DFA
item.content:encoded:
Department of Foreign Affairs, Iran, Pinoy seafarer, container ship, MSC Aries Summary: The Department of Foreign Affairs announced that Iran will release four Filipino seafarers who were detained as part of the crew of the container ship MSC Aries. The sailors were held after the ship was seized by Iranian authorities in recent weeks. The Philippine government worked with Iranian officials to secure the release of the crew members and they are expected to be freed soon. This news brings relief to the families of the seafarers and is a positive development in the diplomatic efforts between the Philippines and Iran. It highlights the importance of cooperation between countries in resolving maritime incidents and ensuring the safety and well-being of seafarers around the world. The incident serves as a reminder of the risks that Filipino seafarers face in their line of work and the need for strong support and advocacy for their protection.

Summary:

Sinabi ng isang opisyal ng Department of Foreign Affairs na palalayain ng Iran ang apat na Pinoy seafarer na kabilang sa crew ng container ship na MSC Aries na kanilang kinubkob kamakailan.

item.title: DMW to recommend Strait of Hormuz as 'high-risk area' to protect Pinoy seafarers
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Department of Migrant Workers, recommendation, high-risk area, Strait of Hormuz, seizure Summary:

The Department of Migrant Workers plans to recommend classifying the Strait of Hormuz as a "high-risk area" due to Iran's recent seizure of an Israel-linked ship in the region. This move follows the heightened tensions in the waterway and aims to enhance safety measures for vessels passing through. The decision to designate the area as high-risk underscores the potential threats posed by ongoing conflicts and geopolitical issues in the region. By taking proactive steps to address the security concerns, the Department of Migrant Workers hopes to prevent future incidents and safeguard the interests of ships and crews navigating through the Strait of Hormuz. This classification could lead to increased surveillance, patrols, and security protocols to mitigate risks and ensure the safe passage of vessels in the critically strategic waterway.

The Department of Migrant Workers said it will recommend the Strait of Hormuz to be classified as a  “high-risk area” following Iran's seizure of an Israel-linked ship in the waterway over the weekend.

item.title: NGCP extends Luzon Grid red alert
item.content:encoded:
NGCP, National Grid Corporation of the Philippines, red alert status, Luzon Grid, outage Summary:

The National Grid Corporation of the Philippines (NGCP) has extended the red alert status of the Luzon Grid for another seven hours due to the outage of two additional plants, adding to the 19 plants already on forced outage. This extension of the red alert status indicates a critical shortage of power supply in the region. With a significant number of power plants unable to generate electricity, the stability and reliability of the grid are at risk. The NGCP's decision highlights the urgent need to address issues affecting the power generation sector to prevent further disruptions in electricity supply. Stakeholders, including power plant operators and regulatory bodies, need to work together to improve the resilience of the grid and ensure uninterrupted power supply for Luzon.

The National Grid Corporation of the Philippines (NGCP) on Tuesday extended the red alert status of the Luzon Grid for another seven hours, due to the outage of two additional plants after it earlier reported 19 plants on forced outage.

item.title: Singapore FM warns of 'bleak' future for ASEAN, Indo-Pacific if SCS tensions rise
item.content:encoded: Singapore Foreign Minister Vivian Balakrishnan warned of a “bleak” future for the Indo-Pacific region if the ongoing tensions in the South China Sea escalate into a full-blown conflict.

item.title: House panel approves Anti-Doping in Sports bill
item.content:encoded: The House Committee on Youth and Sports Development on Tuesday approved the proposed Anti-Doping in Sports Act.

item.title: Mga mambabatas sa Georgia, nagsuntukan habang may sesyon sa kanilang Kongreso
item.content:encoded: Nauwi sa suntukan ng mga mambabatas ang mainit na pagtalakay ng kanilang Kongreso sa tinatawag na "Foreign Agents" bill.

item.title: PH-US Balikatan Exercise 2024 'biggest" with inter-agency participation
item.content:encoded: Balikatan 2024 between the Philippines and the United States will be the biggest iteration of joint military exercise with the participation of various government agencies as well as units from Australia and France.

item.title: Atty. Vic Rodriguez, sinabing dapat sumailalim si Pres. Marcos sa 'credible' drug test
item.content:encoded: Para matapos na umano ang usapin sa hinalang gumagamit ng ilegal na droga, sinabi ni Atty. Vic Rodriguez na dapat sumailalim sa "credible hair follicle drug test" ang dati niyang "boss" na si Pangulong Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr.

item.title: Remulla orders probe on Alvarez"s call to withdraw support from Marcos
item.content:encoded: Justice Secretary Jesus Crispin Remulla on Tuesday ordered an investigation on whether Davao del Norte Representative Pantaleon Alvarez"s call to withdraw support from President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. was seditious.

item.title: No jails will be built in Masungi Georeserve -- BuCor
item.content:encoded:
Masungi Georeserve, Rizal, BuCor, Director General, prison facilities
Summary: Director General Gregorio Catapang Jr. of the Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) assured on Tuesday that no prison facilities will be constructed in the Masungi Georeserve in Rizal. This assurance alleviates concerns about the potential impact on the environment and surrounding community. The decision was likely made in response to public outcry and advocacy efforts to protect the conservation area. By respecting the natural beauty and biodiversity of the Masungi Georeserve, BuCor is demonstrating a commitment to responsible development and environmental preservation. This announcement is a positive step towards safeguarding the unique ecosystem of the georeserve while also upholding the principles of sustainable land management. BuCor's pledge to refrain from building prison facilities in the Masungi Georeserve reflects a recognition of the importance of balancing development with conservation efforts.

Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) Director General Gregorio Catapang Jr. on Tuesday assured that no prison facilities will be constructed in the Masungi Georeserve in Rizal.

item.title: Alvarez on call for AFP to withdraw support: How is it seditious?
item.content:encoded:
deny, sedition, appeal, military, support Summary:
Davao del Norte Rep. Pantaleon Alvarez denied committing sedition when he appealed to the military to withdraw their support from Pres. Marcos. Alvarez defended his actions, stating that it was his duty as a lawmaker to address issues affecting the country. He emphasized that his appeal was motivated by his desire to uphold democracy and the rule of law in the Philippines. The congressman's statements sparked controversy and debate among political circles, with some criticizing him for inciting dissent against the government. However, Alvarez stood by his call for the military to remain neutral and uphold their duty to protect the Filipino people. Despite the backlash, he maintained that his intention was to promote transparency and accountability in governance.

Davao del Norte Rep. Pantaleon Alvarez on Tuesday denied committing sedition when he appealed to the military to withdraw their support from Pres. Marcos.

item.title: 55 Chinese vessels monitored in WPS features --PH Navy
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Chinese vessels, monitored, West Philippine Sea, features, 55
Summary:
A total of 55 Chinese vessels were monitored in various features within the West Philippine Sea. The presence of these vessels raises concerns about China's maritime activities and territorial claims in the region. The monitoring of these vessels provides valuable insight into China's actions in the disputed waters. The West Philippine Sea is a hotly contested area with multiple countries claiming sovereignty over various parts. The continuous presence of Chinese vessels in the area could further escalate tensions among the countries involved. Efforts to monitor and track these vessels are crucial in maintaining peace and stability in the region.

A total of 55 Chinese vessels were monitored in different features in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Myrtle Sarrosa, wagi bilang 2023 PH Esports Content Streamer of the Year
item.content:encoded: Nanalo si Myrtle Sarrosa bilang Content Streamer of the Year sa 2023 Philippine Esports Awards.

item.title: DOTr: Traffic unaffected by strike, plans to 'move forward" with PUVMP
item.content:encoded: The Department of Transportation on Tuesday said the two-day transport strike by PISTON and MANIBELA did not paralyze the flow of traffic as it now focuses .

item.title: Protest rally at Welcome Rotonda ends; DOTr says transport strike just created traffic
item.content:encoded: The protest rally against the government's PUV Modernization Program at Welcome Rotonda at the boundary of Quezon City and Manila ended Tuesday morning. The Department of Transportation however said the transport strike was successful only in creating traffic.

item.title: WPS fishers output increased by 15% in 2023 -Centino
item.content:encoded: The output of fishers in the West Philippine Sea (WPS) increased by 15% from 2022 to 2023, Presidential Assistant for Maritime Concerns Andres Centino said on Tuesday.

item.title: Tone-toneladang isdang bangkulis, nahuli sa Ligao, Albay
item.content:encoded: Nahuli ng mga mangingisda ang tone-toneladang isdang bangkulis sa Ligao, Albay.

item.title: Almost 114,000 evacuated due to floods in Kazakhstan
item.content:encoded: Almost 114,000 people have been evacuated due to floods in Kazakhstan, the Central Asian nation's emergencies ministry said on Tuesday.

item.title: NGCP announces possible power interruptions in parts of Luzon
item.content:encoded: NGCP has announced possible power service interruptions in parts of Luzon on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: PH divers create nurseries for rescued coral
item.content:encoded:
scuba diving, coral nurseries, Philippines, Manila, propagation Summary:
A group of scuba diving experts and enthusiasts in the Philippines, south of the capital Manila, are establishing coral nurseries to aid in the propagation and recovery of damaged coral. The team consists of experienced divers who are passionate about marine conservation and are taking action to restore the marine ecosystem. By setting up the nurseries in a popular dive spot, they aim to not only help the damaged coral but also create awareness among other divers. The initiative showcases the dedication of the diving community to protect and preserve the marine environment. With a focus on sustainability, the project is set to contribute positively to the ongoing efforts in coral reef restoration and conservation. The establishment of these nurseries signifies a step forward in fostering a healthier marine environment and promoting responsible diving practices.

Summary:

A group of scuba diving experts and enthusiasts are setting up coral nurseries in a popular dive spot south of Philippine capital Manila to help in the propagation and recovery of damaged coral.

item.title: Lalaki, huli sa pangmomolestiya't panggagahasa umano sa menor de edad na anak ng kinakasama sa Rizal
item.content:encoded:
molestiyahin, gahasain, menor de edad, Cainta, Rizal
A man has been arrested and detained after allegedly molesting and raping a minor who is the child of his partner in Cainta, Rizal. The incident occurred inside a cell where the man was being held. The suspect's actions were deemed unacceptable, with authorities taking immediate action against him. The victim's family and the community are demanding justice for the heinous crime committed against the minor. The man is now facing criminal charges for his egregious behavior towards the young victim, and he is expected to face the full extent of the law for his actions. The incident has sparked outrage and concern among residents, highlighting the need for stricter enforcement of laws to protect minors from such despicable acts of violence.

Summary:

Sa kulungan ang bagsak ng isang lalaki matapos niyang molestiyahin at gahasain umano ang menor de edad na anak ng kaniyang kinakasama sa Cainta, Rizal.

item.title: After 'biggest' drug haul, Marcos tells syndicates: Aabutan namin kayo
item.content:encoded:
drug bust, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., drug syndicates, prosecution, law enforcement Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. issued a warning to members of drug syndicates following a major drug bust in the country. The President emphasized that his administration would prosecute those involved in drug trafficking with the full force of the law. This drug bust has been described as one of the largest in the country's history, signaling a strong stance against drug-related crimes. President Marcos Jr. reiterated his commitment to law enforcement and ensuring that drug syndicates are held accountable for their actions. This warning comes as a clear message to those involved in illegal drug activities, indicating a crackdown on drug trafficking operations. The President's statement underscores the government's determination to combat the drug trade and protect the citizens from the harms associated with illicit substances.

Summary:

In the wake of what has been described as possibly one of biggest drug busts in the country's history, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Tuesday warned members of drug syndicates that his administration would prosecute them with the full force of the law.

item.title: Luzon and Visayas grids to be placed on red, yellow alerts
item.content:encoded:
National Grid Corporation of the Philippines, Luzon, Visayas, grids, red alert, yellow alert Summary: The National Grid Corporation of the Philippines announced that both the Luzon and Visayas grids will be under red and yellow alert. This situation indicates a tight power supply and a possible load curtailment may occur. Consumers are advised to conserve electricity to avoid disruptions in power services. The alerts are a result of various factors such as the high demand for electricity due to the summer season and limited availability of power supply from some plants. This situation highlights the importance of efficient energy management and the need for continuous monitoring of the power grid to ensure stable and reliable power supply for the consumers.

The National Grid Corporation of the Philippines said Tuesday Luzon and Visayas grids will be placed on red and yellow alert.

item.title: Ex-ES Vic Rodriguez urges Marcos to undergo 'credible' drug test
item.content:encoded:
former executive secretary, Atty. Vic Rodriguez, President Marcos, undergo, credible, hair follicle drug test President Marcos' former executive secretary, Atty. Vic Rodriguez, urged him to undergo a "credible hair follicle drug test." Rodriguez believes that Marcos should undergo the test to prove that he is drug-free and to dispel any doubts regarding his health and well-being. The call for the test comes amidst concerns that Marcos may be under the influence of drugs, which could potentially affect his decision-making abilities and overall performance as a leader. Rodriguez emphasized the importance of transparency and accountability in public service and urged Marcos to take the test to address any lingering doubts or suspicions. The results of the drug test would provide clarity and reassurance to the public regarding Marcos' health and fitness to lead, ensuring that he is not compromised in any way.

Summary: President Marcos' former executive secretary, Atty. Vic Rodriguez, urges him to undergo a "credible hair follicle drug test" to dispel any doubts regarding his health and well-being. Rodriguez emphasizes the importance of transparency and accountability in public service, calling for the test to address concerns about Marcos' potential drug use and its impact on his leadership. The test results would provide clarity and reassurance to the public, ensuring that Marcos is fit to lead without any compromising factors.

President Marcos' former executive secretary, Atty. Vic Rodriguez, on Tuesday urged him to undergo a "credible hair follicle drug test."

item.title: CAAP warns vs flying kites near airport following incident in Catanduanes
item.content:encoded: The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines (CAAP) has warned against the flying of kites near the airport in Virac, Catanduanes after the nylon string of a kite got entangled in the wings of an airplane.

item.title: FBI opens criminal probe in Baltimore bridge collapse; fourth body recovered
item.content:encoded:
FBI, criminal probe, Baltimore bridge, ship crash, fourth body
Summary:
The FBI has launched a criminal probe into the collapse of a Baltimore bridge in March, following a ship crashing into a bridge support. Local officials have confirmed the recovery of a fourth body from the incident. The investigation will focus on determining the cause of the collapse and any possible negligence or wrongdoing that may have led to the tragedy. The bridge collapse has raised concerns about infrastructure safety and the need for proper maintenance and monitoring of bridges. The recovery of another body underscores the tragic loss of life that resulted from the accident, highlighting the importance of ensuring the safety of transportation infrastructure for the public. The FBI's involvement in the case signifies the seriousness of the incident and the potential legal implications for those responsible for the bridge collapse.

Summary:

The FBI said on Monday it opened a criminal probe into the collapse of a Baltimore bridge in March when a ship crashed into a bridge support, while local officials confirmed the recovery of a fourth body from the incident.

item.title: PISTON, MANIBELA hold 2nd day of transport strike vs. PUV modernization
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: transport groups, strike, PUV modernization program, government, protest
Summary:
Two transport groups staged a second day of strike to oppose the government's PUV modernization program. The groups are protesting against the program, which aims to upgrade public utility vehicles and improve transportation services in the country. The strike has caused disruptions in public transportation, affecting commuters who rely on these services for their daily commute. The government's modernization program has faced resistance from various transport groups, who argue that the new requirements are too costly for operators and drivers. The strike is a display of their discontent and a call for the government to reconsider the program and its implications on the livelihood of PUV operators and drivers.

Two transport groups continued with their second day of strike on Tuesday to protest the public utility vehicle (PUV) modernization program of the government.

item.title: Panama Canal increases crossings as drought eases
item.content:encoded:
Panama Canal, booking slots, Panamax locks, water levels, drought

The Panama Canal announced an increase in booking slots for its Panamax locks starting May 16 due to improved water levels in the artificial lake. The canal authority cited an easing of a drought that had previously led to cuts in daily crossings. This move will allow for more efficient and reliable transit through the canal, benefiting shippers and businesses relying on the waterway for trade. The decision reflects the canal's proactive approach to managing water resources and ensuring uninterrupted operation. By adjusting booking slots based on current conditions, the Panama Canal can better accommodate shipping traffic while maintaining the safety and integrity of its infrastructure. This development signals a positive outlook for the canal's operations and underscores the importance of adaptive measures in response to changing environmental factors.

Summary:

The Panama Canal will increase booking slots for its Panamax locks from May 16 due to estimated water levels of the artificial lake which it draws from, the canal authority said on Monday, pointing to an easing of a drought that had caused cuts in daily crossings.

item.title: Rebels raise flag at seized Myanmar base, commander confident of retaining control
item.content:encoded:
burned, flag, military government, rebel commander, army base
Myanmar resistance fighters burned the flag used by the military government and raised their own banner at a newly captured army base near the Thai border. The senior rebel commander vowed to hold the strategic area. The fighters showed their defiance by symbolically burning the flag and replacing it with their own. The captured army base is a significant achievement for the resistance fighters as they continue to fight against the military government. The rebel commander's determination to hold the area demonstrates the strength and resolve of the resistance movement. The symbolic act of burning the flag signifies the fighters' rejection of the military government's authority and their determination to create change in Myanmar through their resistance efforts.

Summary: The Myanmar resistance fighters burned the flag of the military government and raised their own banner at a captured army base near the Thai border. The senior rebel commander vowed to hold the strategic area, demonstrating the strength and resolve of the resistance movement. This symbolic act signifies the fighters' defiance of the military government's authority and their determination to create change in Myanmar through their resistance efforts.

Myanmar resistance fighters on Monday burned the flag used by the military government and raised their own banner at a newly captured army base, as a senior rebel commander vowed they would hold the strategic area near the Thai border.

item.title: Man stabbed dead in GenSan brawl
item.content:encoded:
stabbed, dead, brawl, General Santos City, GMA Regional TV One Mindanao report Summary: A man was fatally stabbed during a brawl in General Santos City as reported by GMA Regional TV One Mindanao. The incident resulted in the tragic death of the victim. The stabbing occurred amidst a heated altercation, leading to the loss of life. The altercation escalated into violence, resulting in a fatal outcome for the man involved. Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding the brawl and the motives behind the stabbing incident. The altercation in General Santos City turned deadly, highlighting the dangers of violence and conflict in the community. The tragic incident serves as a reminder of the need for peaceful resolutions and conflict management to prevent such senseless acts of violence. The chilling event underscores the importance of promoting peace and understanding to minimize such fatal confrontations.

Summary:

A man was stabbed dead in a brawl in General Santos City, according to a GMA Regional TV One Mindanao report on "Saksi."

item.title: Infant found dead inside a box in a cemetery in Pangasinan
item.content:encoded:
infants, dead, found, cemetery, boarding house Summary: Two infants were found dead in separate locations, one in a box inside a cemetery in Pangasinan and the other behind a boarding house in Bohol. The caretaker of the public cemetery in Binmaley, Pangasinan, observed a woman on a motorcycle carrying a box, bringing attention to the discovery. The incidents are under investigation to determine the circumstances surrounding the deaths of the infants. The authorities are seeking information from the public to assist in identifying the individuals responsible for these tragic events. The community is urged to come forward with any relevant details that may help in solving this heartbreaking case.

Summary:

Two infants were found dead in separate places. One was found in a box inside a cemetery in Pangasinan while the other one was found behind a boarding house in Bohol. According to the report of GMA Regional TV One North Central Luzon's Russell Simorio on "Saksi," the caretaker of the public cemetery in Binmaley, Pangasinan noticed a woman onboard a motorcycle carrying a box.

item.title: P12-M worth of property destroyed in Cebu City fire
item.content:encoded:
fire, Cebu City, property, destroyed, P12 million Summary: A fire in Cebu City early Sunday morning resulted in the destruction of approximately P12 million worth of property. The incident, as reported by GMA Regional TV Balitang Bisdak, caused significant damage to the area. The fire spread rapidly, causing extensive loss and devastation before it was eventually contained. The exact cause of the fire is unknown at this time, and an investigation is likely underway to determine the factors that contributed to the blaze. The total value of the property destroyed underscores the magnitude of the disaster, highlighting the need for prompt and effective emergency response measures to prevent similar incidents in the future. The residents and property owners affected by the fire are likely facing significant challenges in the aftermath of the incident, as they work to rebuild and recover from the extensive damage caused by the fire.

About P12 million worth of property was destroyed in a fire that hit Cebu City early Sunday morning, according to the GMA Regional TV Balitang Bisdak report of Marisol Abdurahman on "Saksi."

item.title: Transport groups hold vigil in Quezon City after strike
item.content:encoded:
Vigil, Transport groups, PISTON, MANIBELA, Mabuhay Rotonda Summary: Transport groups PISTON and MANIBELA held a vigil at Mabuhay Rotonda in Quezon City following the first day of their two-day transport strike. The groups gathered to protest against issues affecting drivers and operators nationwide. The strike aimed to raise awareness of the challenges faced by the transport sector, including rising fuel prices and the impact of the pandemic on livelihoods. The vigil at Mabuhay Rotonda served as a symbolic gathering to show unity and solidarity among drivers and operators. The groups expressed their demands for government support and assistance to address their concerns and improve their working conditions. The strike and vigil highlighted the ongoing struggles of the transport sector and called for solutions to alleviate their hardships. Overall, the event was a demonstration of collective action and advocacy for the rights and welfare of transport workers.

Summary:

Transport groups, Pagkakaisa ng mga Samahan ng Tsuper at Opereytor Nationwide (PISTON) and Samahang Manibela Mananakay at Nagkaisang Terminal ng Transportasyon or MANIBELA, held a vigil at Mabuhay Rotonda in Quezon City following the first day of their planned two-day transport strike, EJ Gomez reported on "Saksi."

item.title: Pres. Marcos, sinabing maraming 'palusot' sa umano'y 'secret' deal ni ex-Pres Duterte sa China
item.content:encoded:
criticism, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., differing statements, secret agreement, China
Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. criticized the differing statements from the camp of former President Rodrigo Duterte regarding the alleged "secret" agreement entered into by the previous administration with China. Marcos Jr. pointed out the inconsistencies in the explanations given by Duterte's team regarding the said agreement. Duterte's camp has been giving conflicting statements about the nature and details of the supposed secret deal with China, leading to confusion and speculation among the public. Marcos Jr. raised concerns about the lack of transparency and clarity surrounding the agreement, emphasizing the need for accountability and honesty in dealing with matters of national interest. The controversy has reignited discussions about the country's foreign policy and the importance of safeguarding national sovereignty and interests in dealings with other nations.

Pinuna ni Pangulong Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. nitong Lunes ang magkakaiba umanong pahayag ng kampo ni dating Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte tungkol sa sinasabing "secret" agreement na pinasok ng dating administrasyon sa China.

item.title: Pres. Marcos, tinawag na 'it's complicated' ang relasyon niya sa pamilya Duterte; pero Ok sila ni VP Sara
item.content:encoded:
complicated, relationship, family Duterte, criticism, Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
Summary: In a recent interview, Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. described his relationship with the Duterte family as "complicated." He acknowledged the criticisms and backlash he has received from former President Rodrigo Duterte but did not delve into specifics. Despite the complexities of their relationship, Marcos Jr. did not elaborate on the issues that have strained their interaction. The remarks come amidst speculation about the political dynamics between the two influential families and the impact on future collaborations or conflicts. Duterte's critique of Marcos Jr. adds a layer of complexity to the already intricate web of political alliances and rivalries in the Philippines. Marcos Jr.'s ambiguous response suggests a desire to navigate the complexities of his connections with the Duterte family while maintaining a diplomatic stance.

Inilarawan ni Pangulong Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. na "it's complicated," ang relasyon niya sa pamilya Duterte, sa harap na rin ng mga puna at batikos sa kaniya ni dating Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte.

item.title: Naka-jackpot ng P222-M sa Grand Lotto 6/55, sa Caloocan City tumaya
item.content:encoded:
outlet, Caloocan City, ticket, Grand Lotto 6/55 draw, winner Summary: A lotto outlet in Caloocan City was visited by a lucky winner who purchased a ticket that won more than P222 million in the Grand Lotto 6/55 draw held on Saturday, April 13. The single ticket holder struck it big with the massive jackpot prize. The winning ticket was the only one that matched all the winning numbers, making the winner an instant multi-millionaire. The lucky individual took a chance and now reaps the rewards of their timely decision to play the lottery. The significant amount won in the draw has brought joy and excitement not only to the winner but also to the local community. It serves as a reminder of the life-changing opportunities that can come from participating in lottery games like the Grand Lotto 6/55.

Sa lotto outlet sa Caloocan City tinayaan ng mananaya ang ticket na solong tumama ng mahigit P222 milyon sa Grand Lotto 6/55 draw noong Sabado, April 13.

item.title: No winners of Grand Lotto 6/55, Megalotto 6/45 on Monday, April 15, 2024
item.content:encoded:
Lotto, Draws, Winners, Monday, April 15

No winners were announced for either of the major lottery drawings that took place on Monday, April 15, 2024. Both draws ended without producing any jackpot winners. Participants in the lottery eagerly awaited the results, but no one was able to match all the winning numbers to claim the grand prize. The lack of winners in the big lotto draws left many hopeful ticket holders disappointed, as they missed out on the chance to win a significant sum of money. The absence of jackpot winners resulted in the accumulation of the prize pool for the next drawing, increasing the potential winnings for future participants. Despite the anticipation leading up to the draws, it was ultimately a fruitless day for lottery players, as the jackpots remained unclaimed. Players will have to try their luck again in the upcoming draws for another shot at winning the elusive grand prize.

Summary:

There were no winners of either of the big lotto draws held on Monday, April 15, 2024.

item.title: Love triangle eyed as rider shot dead in Manila
item.content:encoded: A motorcycle rider died on the spot after he was shot several times by an unidentified gunman in Sta. Cruz, Manila over the weekend.

item.title: MMDA to issue tickets on e-bikes, e-trikes violating national road ban on Wednesday, April 17
item.content:encoded: The MMDA will start issuing tickets against e-bikes, e-tricycles, e-scooters, pushcarts, tricycles, pedicabs, and “kuliglig” that would violate the ban on national roads on April 17.

item.title: Donors hope to raise more than $1 billion for Sudan a year into war
item.content:encoded:
Paris, aid conference, Sudan, donors, billion euros

At an aid conference in Paris on Monday, donors are expected to pledge well over a billion euros for war-torn Sudan on the first anniversary of a devastating conflict. The diplomatic source stated that the fundraising efforts aim to support the country as it continues to recover from the conflict. The conference is a significant opportunity for the international community to come together and show their solidarity with Sudan during this challenging time. The funds raised will likely go towards humanitarian aid, reconstruction efforts, and development programs to help Sudan rebuild and stabilize. This financial support is crucial in helping Sudan address its immediate needs and work towards long-term peace and stability. Overall, the conference is a crucial step in supporting Sudan's recovery and rebuilding efforts post-conflict.

Summary:

Donors will hopefully pledge "well over a billion euros," ($1.07 billion) for war-torn Sudan at an aid conference in Paris on Monday on the first anniversary of a devastating conflict, a diplomatic source said.

item.title: Teacher's 'discipline waiver' halted by DepEd
item.content:encoded:
Teacher, discipline waiver, complaint, public school, Rizal Summary: A concerned citizen in Rizal filed a complaint about a Grade 2 teacher in a public school who distributed a discipline waiver to her class. The citizen found the waiver troubling, as it seemed to imply that students could escape consequences for their actions by signing it. The teacher's approach to discipline was called into question, with concerns raised about the impact on the children's behavior and understanding of responsibility. The incident highlights the importance of transparent and effective disciplinary practices in schools, ensuring that students learn the appropriate consequences for their actions. The community's response to the complaint will be crucial in addressing the issue and promoting a positive and respectful learning environment for all students.

A concerned citizen has complained about the discipline waiver distributed by a Grace 2 teacher to her class in a public school in Rizal.

item.title: Trump becomes first ex-US president to face criminal trial
item.content:encoded:
Manhattan court, Donald Trump, criminal trial, hush-money payment, porn star Summary: Donald Trump, the first former US president, appeared in a Manhattan court for a criminal trial related to a hush-money payment to a porn star. This marks a significant moment in US history, as Trump is the first ex-president to face such charges. The trial is focused on the payment made to the porn star to keep quiet about an alleged affair with Trump. This case has been a long-standing legal issue for Trump, and his appearance in court has garnered significant media attention. It remains to be seen how the trial will unfold and what impact it will have on Trump's political career.

Donald Trump became the first former US president to stand criminal trial on Monday when he appeared in a Manhattan court to face charges stemming from a hush-money payment to a porn star.

item.title: LTFRB: PISTON, MANIBELA strike did not disrupt public transport
item.content:encoded: The LTFRB on Monday said it did not monitor any disruption in public transportation amid the nationwide strike against government's public utility vehicle modernization program.

item.title: Mga goldfish, marunong magmalasakit sa kapuwa nila?
item.content:encoded: Ikinamangha ng mga netizen ang ginawa ng mga goldfish na tila may malasakit sa isa nilang kasamahan na naipit at nakulong sa mga bato sa isang creek sa China.

item.title: IRR for amnesty to ex-rebels awaiting signatures
item.content:encoded: The government has yet to release the implementing rules and regulations (IRR) of the amnesty proclamations for former rebels as the document still lacks the signatures of concerned Cabinet officials.

item.title: Marcos: PH better served by 'critical" not 'cooperative" press
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on Monday assured that he will defend press freedom in the country as he encouraged media practitioners to perform their job without restriction.

item.title: Nasa 2 toneladang hinihinalang shabu na abot sa P13.3B ang halaga, nasabat sa Batangas
item.content:encoded: Humigit kumulang dalawang tonelada ng hinihinalang shabu ang nasabat sa checkpoint ng mga awtoridad na nasa isang van sa Alitagtag, Batangas. Ang halaga nito, umaabot sa P13.3 billion, ayon sa pulisya.

item.title: Marcos: PH-Japan reciprocal access agreement nearly done
item.content:encoded:
President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., Reciprocal Access Agreement, Philippines, Japan, completion Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. announced that the Reciprocal Access Agreement (RAA) between the Philippines and Japan is close to being finalized. The agreement, which will enhance defense cooperation between the two countries, is in its final stages of completion. Once implemented, the RAA will allow for increased military cooperation, joint training exercises, and mutual visits between the Philippines and Japan. President Marcos highlighted the significance of the agreement in strengthening security and defense ties between the two nations. The RAA is expected to further bolster the strategic partnership between the Philippines and Japan, promoting peace and stability in the region.

President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Monday said that the Reciprocal Access Agreement (RAA) between the Philippines and Japan is nearing its completion.

item.title: DOT awards winners of Tourism Champions Challenge
item.content:encoded:
LGUs, funding, proposals, Department of Tourism, challenge Summary:

Three local government units will be receiving P25 million each in funding to support their winning proposals through a challenge by the Department of Tourism. This initiative aims to provide financial assistance to LGUs for projects that promote tourism in their respective areas. The funding will help the LGUs implement their proposed projects effectively and improve tourism infrastructure and services. By supporting these initiatives, the DOT hopes to boost tourism across the country and attract more visitors to different destinations. This funding will enable the LGUs to develop and enhance their tourism offerings, ultimately benefiting local communities and economies.

Three local government units (LGUs) will each receive P25 million in funding to support their winning proposals as part of a challenge initiated by the Department of Tourism (DOT).

item.title: Estudyante, patay nang bumangga ang minamanehong motorsiklo sa nakaparadang truck
item.content:encoded:
19-year-old, student, motorcycle, accident, truck Summary: A 19-year-old student tragically lost his life after his motorcycle collided with a parked truck on the side of the road in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. The accident occurred when the student was driving his motorcycle and crashed into the stationary truck. The impact of the collision caused fatal injuries to the student, leading to his untimely death at the scene. The authorities were alerted to the accident, and emergency responders arrived at the scene to attend to the victim. Despite their efforts, the student could not be saved. The incident serves as a reminder of the importance of road safety and the need for vigilance while driving or riding a motorcycle. The tragic loss of the young student has left his family, friends, and community in mourning as they come to terms with the sudden and devastating loss. May the victim rest in peace.

Summary:

Nasawi ang isang 19-anyos na estudyante matapos na bumangga ang minamaneho niyang motorsiklo sa isang nakaparadang truck sa gilid ng daan sa Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.

item.title: Driver ng MPV na nakaidlip habang nagmamaneho, bumangga sa 2 SUV sa Ilocos Sur
item.content:encoded: Nahuli-cam ang pagbangga ng isang MPV sa dalawang SUV sa Bantay, Ilocos Sur. Ang driver ng MPV, aminado umanong nakaidlip habang nagmamaneho.

item.title: Several people injured in a stabbing in Sydney church, police say
item.content:encoded: A number of people were injured in a stabbing at a church in Walkley, about 30 km (18 miles) west of the Sydney central business district, Australian police authorities said on Monday.

item.title: PH-US agreements 'beyond politics,' Marcos says amid Biden-Trump poll showdown
item.content:encoded: The agreements made by the Philippines and the United States will be honored regardless who will win the US presidential elections as these go "beyond politics".

item.title: Kuwait names Ahmad Abdullah al-Ahmad al-Sabah as prime minister
item.content:encoded: Kuwait's Emir on Monday appointed Ahmad Abdullah al-Ahmad al-Sabah as prime minister, state news agency KUNA reported.

item.title: Marcos on apology to rights victims: That's personal for Marcos family
item.content:encoded: The matter of apologizing to the human rights victims under Martial Law is "a personal matter to the Marcos family," President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. said on Monday.

item.title: Ano ang tamang paraan sa paglilinis ng sapatos para hindi manilaw at maalis ang mga dikit?
item.content:encoded: Naranasan mo na rin bang maglinis ng sapatos na bukod sa nanilaw, at nagkaroon ng amoy, ay naalis pa ang mga dikit gaya ng suwelas? Alamin ang tips tungkol dito ng mag-asawang pinasok ang shoe cleaning business na nagsimula sa puhunang P5,000, at ngayon ay kumikita na nang hanggang P100,000 kada buwan.

item.title: Group wants installation of internet to be lease-free
item.content:encoded: Consumer advocacy group CitizenWatch Philippines on Monday said the installation of broadband connectivity should not bear additional costs to internet providers.

item.title: Over P13-B 'shabu' seized in Batangas
item.content:encoded:
seized, shabu, Alitagtag, Batangas, P13.3 billion Summary: Authorities confiscated around two tons of shabu in Alitagtag, Batangas, with a value exceeding P13.3 billion. The operation was successful in curtailing the distribution of illegal drugs, safeguarding the community from its detrimental effects. Department of the Interior and Local Government Secretary Benhur Abalos commended the decisive action taken by the authorities, emphasizing the significance of such operations in maintaining law and order. The massive seizure underscores the persistent efforts to combat drug trafficking and diminish its influence in society. The substantial amount of shabu intercepted signifies a significant blow to the illegal drug trade, disrupting criminal networks and preventing the proliferation of narcotics. This operation exemplifies the dedication and vigilance of law enforcement agencies in upholding peace and security within the region.

Summary:

Authorities on Monday seized around two tons of shabu in Alitagtag, Batangas worth over P13.3 billion, Department of the Interior and Local Government Secretary Benhur Abalos said.

item.title: Marcos: PH to invoke MDT if Filipino killed in WPS
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, United States, Mutual Defense Treaty, Ferdinand Marcos Jr., West Philippine Sea Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. stated that the Mutual Defense Treaty (MDT) between the Philippines and the United States will be invoked if a Filipino serviceman is killed in the West Philippine Sea (WPS). This emphasizes the importance of the alliance between the two countries and the commitment to protect Filipino nationals in the region. The MDT serves as a security guarantee to ensure the defense of the Philippines against external threats, especially in disputed areas like the WPS. By highlighting the potential invocation of the MDT, President Marcos Jr. underscores the seriousness of the situation and the need for a strong defense mechanism to safeguard Filipino interests in the region. This statement reflects the ongoing geopolitical tensions in the WPS and the strategic implications for both the Philippines and the United States.

President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Monday said that the Mutual Defense Treaty (MDT) between the Philippines and the United States will be invoked if a Filipino serviceman is killed in the West Philippine Sea (WPS).

item.title: Marcos: No plans to grant US access to more bases
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, United States, military bases, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., defense pact Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. of the Philippines stated that there are no intentions to provide the United States with additional access to military bases, after previously doubling the number of bases under a joint defense agreement. This decision comes after the recent increase in the number of U.S. military bases in the Philippines last year. President Marcos Jr. emphasized that there are no plans to further expand the presence of U.S. military in the country. The relationship between the Philippines and the United States continues to be governed by a joint defense pact, but granting additional bases is not in the current agenda. President Marcos Jr.'s announcement signals a shift in the country's military cooperation with the United States, indicating a more restrained approach towards their defense partnership.

The Philippines has no plans to grant the United States access to more military bases, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. said on Monday, after nearly doubling the number last year under a joint defense pact.

item.title: MMDA accepting Chavit"s P200K reward 'illegal', says CSC
item.content:encoded: The MMDA violated the law when it accepted the P200,000 reward that Chavit Singson gave to traffic enforcers who flagged his convoy in the EDSA Busway, the Civil Service Commission said.

item.title: PCG: China Coast Guard did not block PH survey vessels
item.content:encoded: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Monday clarified that the China Coast Guard (CCG) vessel did not block the Philippine survey ships headed for Bajo de Masinloc.

item.title: Marcos calls relationship with Duterte family 'complicated'
item.content:encoded: "It's complicated" - this was how President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. described his relationship with the Duterte family.

item.title: New energy emergency center, mobile units to improve gov"t response to disasters, cyberattacks
item.content:encoded: The government response to natural disasters and cyber security threats is expected to improve with the new Energy Sector Emergency Operations Center and the Mobile Energy System MES.

item.title: Marcos on Duterte's 'secret' deal with China: Maraming palusot
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Monday slammed the contradicting statements made by the camp of former President Rodrigo Duterte on what he called a "secret agreement" between his predecessor and China.

item.title: Pres. Marcos: Hindi isisilbi ng Pilipinas ang arrest warrant na manggagaling sa ICC vs. ex-Pres. Duterte
item.content:encoded: Inihayag ni Pangulong Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. na hindi isisilbi ng kaniyang administrasyon ang anumang arrest warrant na ilalabas ng International Criminal Court (ICC) laban kay dating Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte.

item.title: France has Plan B for Olympics opening ceremony if security requires
item.content:encoded: France has prepared alternatives to holding the July 26 Olympics opening ceremony on the River Seine should security reasons require, President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday.

item.title: PNP: Quiboloy search definitely included areas he frequented
item.content:encoded: The Philippine National Police (PNP) on Monday emphasized that the search for Apollo Quiboloy included places the Kingdom of Jesus Christ (KOJC) leader frequented.

item.title: PNP: Name-dropping woman caught in EDSA Busway could face charges
item.content:encoded: The woman who was apprehended for using the EDSA busway may face charges for claiming to be part of the military and the niece of a major general, the Philippine National Police said on Monday.

item.title: Singapore PM Lee to hand over power to successor Wong on May 15
item.content:encoded: Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, 72, announced on Monday he will hand over power to his successor, Lawrence Wong, on May 15.

item.title: 'Prize' ni Chavit Singson sa MMDA enforcers na humuli sa kaniya, ginawa umanong P200,000
item.content:encoded: Itinaas umano ni Luis "Chavit" Singson nitong Lunes ang "premyo" na ipinangako niya para sa mga tauhan ng Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) dahil sa pagpapatupad ng batas nang sitahin ang kaniyang convoy nang dumaan siya sa EDSA Busway.

item.title: Pagbabawal sa mga E-bike, e-trike sa national roads ng NCR, epektibo na ngayong Lunes, April 15
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: e-bikes, e-trikes, light e-vehicles, national road, Metro Manila
Summary: Starting this Monday, April 15, the ban on e-bikes, e-trikes, and light EVs on national roads in Metro Manila takes effect. This also includes tricycles, carts, pedicabs, and kuliglig. The ban aims to ensure road safety and ease traffic congestion in the bustling capital region. Authorities are implementing stricter regulations to prevent accidents involving these non-motorized vehicles. Violators will face penalties and fines for using prohibited vehicles on national roads. Motorists are advised to comply with the new rules and be mindful of the ban when traveling within Metro Manila. The government is also looking to provide alternative transportation options and support the transition to more sustainable modes of transportation in the city.

Summary:

Epektibo na simula ngayong Lunes, Abril 15, ang pagbabawal sa e-bikes, e-trikes, at light e-vehicles (EVs) sa mga national road sa Metro Manila. Kasama rin dito ang mga tricycle, kariton, pedicab, at kuliglig.

item.title: Solons seek full disclosure of Duterte's 'gentleman's agreement' with China
item.content:encoded:
probe, gentleman's agreement, BRP Sierra Madre, Ayungin Shoal, West Philippine Sea Summary: Lawmakers are calling for an investigation into a supposed "gentleman's agreement" between former President Rodrigo Duterte and China regarding the BRP Sierra Madre stationed in Ayungin Shoal in the West Philippine Sea. The agreement has raised concerns about the sovereignty of the Philippines over the disputed shoal and questions the motives behind such a deal. The BRP Sierra Madre serves as a strategic outpost for the Philippines in the region, and any agreements that compromise its position are subject to scrutiny. Lawmakers are seeking clarification on the terms of the agreement and whether it infringes on the country's territorial integrity. The probe aims to shed light on the actions taken by the Duterte administration in relation to Chinese interests in the West Philippine Sea and ensure that the country's sovereignty is upheld.

Lawmakers have called for a probe of the 'gentleman"s agreement" regarding BRP Sierra Madre in Ayungin Shoal in the West Philippine Sea between former president Rodrigo Duterte and China.

item.title: Brawner: Possible Taiwan-conflict refugees may flee to PH
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, Armed Forces, AFP, refugees, Taiwan
Summary:
The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) is preparing for the possibility of an influx of refugees from Taiwan in the event of a conflict. The AFP is anticipating the potential arrival of refugees in the Philippines should conflict erupt in Taiwan. This proactive stance is essential for the AFP to have contingency plans in place to address the needs of any refugees seeking shelter and assistance. The AFP's readiness highlights the importance of strategic planning and preparedness for various scenarios that may arise in the region. The AFP's proactive approach underscores their commitment to fulfilling their role in providing aid and support during times of crisis.

The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) was anticipating the possible arrival of refugees in the Philippines if conflict breaks out in Taiwan.

item.title: AFP developing strategic bases covering Philippines' EEZ -- Brawner
item.content:encoded: The Armed of the Philippines (AFP) said it is establishing strategic bases to cover the country"s exclusive economic zone (EEZ).

item.title: Marcos: PH will not serve arrest warrant from ICC vs. ex-Pres. Duterte
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Monday explicitly stated that his government will not serve any arrest warrant from the International Criminal Court (ICC) against former President Rodrigo Duterte.

item.title: AFP, PNP reiterate loyalty to Constitution amid call to withdraw support from Marcos
item.content:encoded: The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) and the Philippine National Police (PNP) on Monday gave reassurance of their loyalty to the 1987 Constitution amid a call to withdraw support from President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr.

item.title: Marcos: US-Japan-PH trilateral agreement 'not directed against anyone'
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Monday said that the cooperation agreement by the Philippines, the United States, and Japan is not directed against anyone and not a direct response to "incidents" that are happening against the Philippines.

item.title: US military destroyed 80 drones, 6 missiles launched from Iran, Yemen, US Centcom says
item.content:encoded: US forces, supported by US European Command destroyers, on Saturday and Sunday destroyed more than 80 one-way attack drones and at least six ballistic missiles aimed at Israel from Iran and Yemen, the US Central Command (CENTCOM) said on Monday.

item.title: 122 newly appointed, promoted prosecutors take oath at DOJ
item.content:encoded:
appointments, prosecutors, Marcos administration, oath, Department of Justice Summary:

Several prosecutors appointed under the Marcos administration and recently promoted prosecutors were sworn in at the Department of Justice. The ceremony took place on Monday, where the new batch of prosecutors pledged to uphold their duties and responsibilities. These appointments signify a new chapter in the legal system under the current administration. The event marks a significant moment in the career of these prosecutors, highlighting their commitment to upholding justice and the rule of law in the country. The Department of Justice oversees the selection and appointment of prosecutors, ensuring a fair and transparent process. By taking their oath, these prosecutors have formally accepted their roles and responsibilities in upholding justice and serving the people. The ceremony is a testament to the government's efforts to strengthen the legal system and ensure that justice is served for all.

The first batch of prosecutors appointed under the Marcos administration and those who were recently promoted took their oath on Monday at the Department of Justice.

item.title: Huge amount of cash found by traffic enforcers; MMDA seeks owner
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: unattended cash, traffic enforcers, Metropolitan Manila Development Authority, large amount, discovered. Summary:

Traffic enforcers from the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority have discovered a substantial amount of unattended cash. The exact details of the amount found have not been disclosed, but it is described as a "huge" sum. The cash was found unattended, raising questions about its origin and ownership. The MMDA is currently working on identifying the rightful owner of the cash and ensuring that it is properly returned. The discovery of such a large amount of unattended cash highlights the importance of vigilance and accountability, especially in public spaces where valuables may be accidentally misplaced or left unattended. The MMDA's prompt action in handling this situation will hopefully lead to a positive and transparent resolution for all parties involved.

Summary:

Traffic enforcers have found a huge amount of unattended cash, the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) said on Monday.

item.title: Skyway being checked if affected by Sales Road deep hole --MMDA
item.content:encoded:
checking, deep hole, Sales Road, Skyway foundation, Metropolitan Manila Development Authority Summary: Authorities are currently investigating the impact of a deep hole on Sales Road on the integrity of Skyway's foundation. The Metropolitan Manila Development Authority announced this on Monday. The investigation aims to determine if the hole is causing any damage or instability to the Skyway infrastructure. The hole has raised concerns about potential risks to the structural integrity of the Skyway, prompting authorities to take action. It is crucial to assess and address any possible consequences of the hole on the highway's foundation to ensure the safety of commuters and prevent any potential accidents.

Authorities are now checking if the deep hole on Sales Road is affecting the integrity of Skyway"s foundation, the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority said on Monday.

item.title: 3 suspected Dawlah Islamiyah members killed in Lanao del Norte
item.content:encoded:
Alleged members, Dawlah Islamiyah, Maute Group, encounter, Munai

Three alleged members of Dawlah Islamiyah - Maute Group were killed in an encounter in Munai, Lanao del Norte, according to the Armed Forces' Western Mindanao Command (Westmincom). The operation took place in response to reports of armed individuals in the area, leading to a gunfight between the military and the suspects. The three suspects were confirmed to be part of the extremist group responsible for previous attacks in the region. The encounter resulted in the neutralization of the armed threats, ensuring the safety of the local community. Westmincom continues its efforts to combat terrorism and maintain peace and security in the region, urging the public to report any suspicious activities or individuals to authorities. The successful operation demonstrates the military's commitment to eliminating threats posed by extremist groups in Lanao del Norte.

Summary:

Three alleged members of Dawlah Islamiyah - Maute Group were killed in an encounter in Munai, Lanao del Norte, the Armed Forces" Western Mindanao Command (Westmincom) said on Sunday.

item.title: Iran says it gave warning before attacking Israel; US says that's not true
item.content:encoded:
Turkish, Jordanian, Iraqi, officials, Iran
Summary: Turkish, Jordanian, and Iraqi officials claim that Iran provided advanced notice of its drone and missile attack on Israel, while US officials deny receiving any warning from Tehran. The attack was reportedly aimed at causing significant damage. The conflicting reports suggest a lack of communication between Iran and the US, raising concerns about escalating tensions in the region. Despite the warning given to neighboring countries, Iran's actions highlight its aggressive stance towards Israel and its allies. The incident underscores the volatile nature of the situation in the Middle East and the potential for further conflict between Iran and its adversaries. Given the lack of transparency and coordination between the involved parties, the situation remains precarious and unpredictable.

Summary:

WASHINGTON/BAGHDAD/DUBAI -- Turkish, Jordanian and Iraqi officials said on Sunday that Iran gave wide notice days before its drone and missile attack on Israel, but US officials said Tehran did not warn Washington and that it was aiming to cause significant damage.

item.title: PH urges parties to refrain from escalating Israel-Iran tensions
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, tensions, Israel, Iran, conflict Summary: The Philippines expressed concern over tensions between Israel and Iran on Monday. item.title: Biden, sinabihan si Netanyahu na 'di sasama ang US kung bubuwelta ang Israel vs. Iran --media reports
item.content:encoded:
United States, President Joe Biden, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Iran, counter-strike Summary: US President Joe Biden reportedly told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that the US would not support Israel if they were to conduct a counter-strike against Iran. This warning comes amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, with concerns about Iran's nuclear program and regional influence. Biden's message to Netanyahu highlights the US's stance on avoiding further conflict in the region and promoting diplomatic solutions. The US continues to navigate its relationships in the Middle East, balancing its support for Israel with its efforts to engage with Iran on nuclear negotiations. This development underscores the delicate political dynamics at play in the region and the strategic decisions being made by key players like the US and Israel. It also signals a shift in US foreign policy under the Biden administration towards prioritizing diplomacy over military actions in addressing regional security challenges.

Sinabihan umano ni US President Joe Biden si Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu na hindi sasama ang Amerika kung balak ng Israeli na magsagawa ng counter-strike laban sa Iran, ayon sa ulat ng CNN at Wall Street Journal nitong Linggo.

item.title: Biden tells Netanyahu US won"t join offensive response vs. Iran --media reports
item.content:encoded:
CNN, Wall Street Journal, Joe Biden, Benjamin Netanyahu, Iran

Summary:
US President Joe Biden has informed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that the United States will not participate in any Israeli counter-offensive against Iran. This decision signifies a shift in US policy towards the Middle East and highlights Biden's intention to prioritize diplomacy and negotiation over military action. The refusal to engage in a potential military conflict with Iran showcases Biden's commitment to de-escalating tensions in the region and pursuing peaceful solutions. The communication between the two leaders underscores the delicate balance of power in the Middle East and the complex relationships between key players in the region. Netanyahu may now have to reassess his approach to dealing with Iran in light of the US stance, potentially leading to changes in Israeli foreign policy towards the Iranian regime.

US President Joe Biden has told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that the United States would not participate in any Israeli counter-offensive against Iran, according to reports on Sunday by CNN and the Wall Street Journal.

The rescue operation successfully freed the conductor from the wreckage, and he was immediately taken to the hospital for medical treatment. The authorities are investigating the cause of the accident to determine any negligence or factors that led to the collision. The incident serves as a reminder of the importance of road safety and proper maintenance of vehicles.

item.title: Iranian airports cancel flights until Monday morning
item.content:encoded:
airports, Tehran, cancelled flights, Monday, tensions
Summary:
Several Iranian airports, including Tehran's Imam Khomeini International, have cancelled flights until Monday, as tensions escalated in the Middle East following Iran's attack on Israel. Iranian state media reported on Sunday that the airports were shutting down operations amidst the heightened conflict. The decision to halt flights was likely made as a precautionary measure to ensure the safety of passengers and staff in light of the ongoing hostilities in the region. The situation remains tense as both countries continue to exchange attacks, raising concerns about further disruptions to air travel. The cancellations are a reflection of the precarious situation in the Middle East and the potential impact of geopolitical tensions on everyday activities such as travel.

Several Iranian airports including Tehran's Imam Khomeini International have cancelled flights until Monday, Iranian state media reported on Sunday, as tensions flared in the Middle East with Iran's attack on Israel overnight.

item.title: Pimentel: Duterte"s agreement with China not binding
item.content:encoded:
China, deals, Duterte, government, investigation Summary: Senate Minority Leader Koko Pimentel expressed that deals made by former President Rodrigo Duterte with China may not be legally binding, suggesting that the government should investigate the details of these agreements. Pimentel's statement raises concerns about the validity and implications of any agreements made between the two countries during Duterte's administration. He urges for transparency and accountability in the examination of these deals to ensure that they align with the interests and welfare of the Filipino people. Duterte's close relationship with China has been a subject of scrutiny, and Pimentel's call for scrutiny reflects a growing skepticism towards the former president's foreign policy decisions. The Senate Minority Leader's remarks highlight the importance of thorough review and evaluation of international agreements to safeguard the sovereignty and national security of the Philippines.

Senate Minority Leader Koko Pimentel said any deals former president Rodrigo Duterte made with China are not binding, suggesting government should look into what actually transpired.

item.title: PHIVOLCS: Phreatic eruption, volcanic tremor recorded at Taal Volcano
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: phreatic eruption, volcanic tremor, Taal Volcano, Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology, weekend Summary:
A phreatic eruption and volcanic tremor were reported at the Taal Volcano by the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) over the weekend. The event raised concerns about potential volcanic activity in the area. Taal Volcano, located in the Philippines, has a history of eruptions, with the most recent major eruption occurring in January 2020. The PHIVOLCS is closely monitoring the situation and providing updates to ensure the safety of residents and visitors in the vicinity. The volcanic tremor indicates increased seismic activity within the volcano, suggesting the movement of magma beneath the surface. The occurrence of a phreatic eruption also highlights the potential for sudden explosive activity, emphasizing the need for continued vigilance and preparedness in the region. Residents are advised to stay informed about the situation and follow safety guidelines provided by authorities to mitigate risks associated with volcanic activity.

A phreatic eruption and a volcanic tremor were recorded at the Taal Volcano over the weekend. the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) said on Sunday.

hole, Sales Road, Pasay City, discovered, authorities Summary: Authorities discovered a deep hole on Sales Road in Pasay City.
