item.title: QC, BJMP transfer PDLs to new city jail facility
item.content:encoded:
BJMP-NCR, Quezon City government, transferring, male PDLs, new QC jail facility Payatas Summary: The Bureau of Jail Management and Penology National Capital Region (BJMP-NCR) and the Quezon City government collaboratively started relocating male persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) to the modern Quezon City jail facility situated in Payatas. The initiative aims to decongest the current detention centers and provide better facilities for the inmates. This strategic move signifies a step towards improving the conditions of detainees in line with human rights standards. By gradually transferring the male PDLs to the newly constructed infrastructure, both BJMP-NCR and the local government of Quezon City are addressing the overcrowding issues in detention facilities. This transition to the updated jail facility in Payatas enhances the management and rehabilitation processes for the PDLs, ensuring a more secure and conducive environment for their reformation and reintegration into society. The cooperation between BJMP-NCR and the Quezon City government demonstrates a commitment to efficient and humane incarceration practices.

Summary:

The BJMP-NCR and the Quezon City government began transferring male persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) to the new QC jail facility in Payatas.

item.title: Sydney knife attacker had mental health issues, ideology not motive, police say

item.title: School in Ilocos Norte unveils region"s first corn maze

Summary: The 79th Foundation Day celebration of the Ilocos Norte Agricultural College in Pasuquin was made even more memorable with the unveiling of the region's inaugural corn maze. This innovative addition added an extra layer of excitement and entertainment to the festivities. The corn maze marked a significant milestone as the first of its kind in the area, showcasing the college's commitment to creativity and exploration. The event drew in a large crowd, enhancing the celebratory atmosphere and bringing the community together in a shared experience of fun and discovery. The corn maze's opening added a new dimension to the traditional festivities, offering a unique attraction that captivated attendees of all ages. The successful debut of the corn maze highlighted the college's dedication to innovation and providing unique experiences for its students and the local community alike. Overall, the inaugural corn maze proved to be a major hit, turning the Foundation Day celebration into a truly unforgettable event.
Summary:

The 79th Foundation Day celebration of the Ilocos Norte Agricultural College in Pasuquin turned into a festive occasion with the formal opening of the region's first-ever corn maze.

item.title: 21 pertussis cases recorded in 4 Bicol provinces
item.content:encoded:
pertussis, whooping cough, cases, DOH Bicol CHD, Bicol Region Summary: The Department of Health Bicol Center for Health Development (DOH Bicol CHD) has reported 21 cases of pertussis, commonly known as whooping cough, across four provinces in the Bicol Region. The cases have prompted health authorities to take action in monitoring and addressing the outbreak. Pertussis is a highly contagious respiratory infection characterized by severe coughing fits, often accompanied by a "whooping" sound when breathing in. Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial in preventing the spread of the disease. The DOH Bicol CHD is working to raise awareness about the importance of vaccination and proper hygiene practices to prevent further cases. Residents in the affected provinces are advised to seek medical attention if they experience symptoms such as coughing fits, especially in infants and young children who are more vulnerable to the disease.

The Department of Health Bicol Center for Health Development (DOH Bicol CHD) has recorded a total of 21 pertussis, or whooping cough, cases in four provinces of the Bicol Region.

item.content:encoded:
condemnation, attack, Iran, Israel, Secretary-General Summary: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres condemned Iran's attack on Israel on Saturday and called for restraint and an immediate cessation of hostilities. Mr. Guterres expressed his concern over the escalating violence and urged all parties involved to de-escalate tensions and prevent further bloodshed. He emphasized the importance of respecting international law and the sanctity of civilian lives. The Secretary-General reiterated his commitment to a peaceful resolution of the conflict through dialogue and diplomacy. He also called on the international community to support efforts to de-escalate the situation and find a sustainable solution to the ongoing conflict.

UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres condemned Iran's attack on Israel on Saturday and called for restraint and an immediate cessation of hostilities.

item.title: Iran attacks Israel with drones, missiles
item.content:encoded:
Iran, explosive drones, missiles, Israel, US
Iran conducted its first direct attack on Israeli territory by launching a swarm of explosive drones and firing missiles late on Saturday. This action has raised concerns of a potential major escalation in the region. The United States has vowed unwavering support for Israel in response to the attack. The use of drones and missiles in the attack marks a significant development in Iran's military capabilities and willingness to engage in direct confrontation with Israel. The attack highlights the ongoing tensions and hostilities between Iran and Israel, with the potential for further conflict and instability in the region. The US backing of Israel further underscores the complex geopolitical dynamics at play in the Middle East and the potential for a broader conflict involving multiple actors.

Summary: Iran launched a swarm of explosive drones and fired missiles at Israel in its first direct attack on Israeli territory, prompting fears of a major escalation. The US expressed strong support for Israel, highlighting the volatile situation in the Middle East and the potential for further conflict between Iran and Israel.

Iran launched a swarm of explosive drones and fired missiles at Israel late on Saturday in its first ever direct attack on Israeli territory, risking a major escalation as the United States pledged "ironclad" backing for Israel.

President Marcos Jr.'s presence at the summit highlights the Philippines' commitment to enhancing its partnerships with key allies. The summit is expected to have positive implications for the Philippines' foreign relations and future collaborations with the US and Japan.

Summary:

President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. is back in the Philippines after attending a trilateral summit with the leaders of the US and Japan in Washington.

item.title: 'Gentleman's agreement' gives away Ayungin Shoal -Carpio
item.content:encoded:
Supreme Court, Antonio Carpio, Ayungin Shoal, China, Duterte Summary:
Former Senior Supreme Court Associate Justice Antonio Carpio stated that a "gentleman's agreement" made by ex-President Rodrigo Duterte seemed to involve giving the Ayungin Shoal to China. Carpio expressed concern about this agreement potentially compromising the Philippines' territorial rights in the disputed waters. The Ayungin Shoal is a strategic location in the South China Sea that is claimed by both the Philippines and China. Carpio's remarks highlight the delicate geopolitical situation in the region and the implications of such agreements on national sovereignty. Duterte's administration has faced criticism for its handling of territorial disputes with China, raising questions about the country's foreign policy and diplomatic decisions. The issue underscores the importance of upholding national interests and safeguarding territorial integrity in the face of complex international relations.

Summary:

Former Senior Supreme Court Associate Justice Antonio Carpio said that the "gentleman's agreement" ex-President Rodrigo Duterte entered into appeared to give the Ayungin Shoal to China.

arrest, Tagaytay City, molestation, child, five years

item.title: Mga residente at turista, nagkagulo sa mga naglipanang isdang turay sa beach resort sa CamSur

Keywords: isda turay, beach resort, Camarines Sur, easy catch, residente at turista Summary: Residents and tourists at a beach resort in Camarines Sur have been enjoying the abundance of turay fish, making them an easy catch for swimmers. However, the easy catch has raised concerns about the sustainability of the fish population and the impact of overfishing on the marine ecosystem. The resort management may need to implement regulations to ensure the conservation of the turay fish population and maintain the ecological balance in the area. As the popularity of the beach resort grows, it is essential to prioritize the preservation of the marine environment to continue attracting visitors and supporting the local economy. item.title: Changes in migratory patterns observed on birds at Cabusao Wetlands
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Cabusao Wetlands, migratory birds, leave, increasing heat, months
Summary:
Migratory birds have been residing in the Cabusao Wetlands for several months, but now they are beginning to depart due to the rising temperatures. The increasing heat is believed to be the reason why these birds are starting to leave the area. This departure marks the end of their stay at the wetlands, where they have been observed and studied for an extended period. The changing climate conditions, specifically the rising heat, are prompting the birds to seek cooler environments and continue their migration journey. Despite the time they have spent at the wetlands, the birds are now moving on as they respond to the changing environmental factors. The departure of these migratory birds signifies a change in the season and highlights the impact of climate change on their behavior and habitat.

Summary:

After spending several months at the Cabusao Wetlands, migratory birds are slowly starting to leave reportedly due to the increasing heat.

item.title: Five killed in Sydney shopping center attack
item.content:encoded:
attacker, Sydney, shopping center, police, killed
Summary: Five people were killed and several others were injured in a knife attack by a rampaging attacker at a busy shopping center in Sydney. The Australian police reported that the attacker went on a rampage, resulting in multiple casualties and injuries. The incident caused chaos and fear as shoppers and employees tried to flee and seek shelter from the violent attack. The attacker used a knife to carry out the assault, causing mass panic and confusion among the people present at the scene. The police responded to the incident quickly and worked to contain the situation, but the attacker managed to inflict fatal injuries on five individuals before being apprehended. The incident highlights the need for heightened security measures and vigilance in public spaces to prevent such tragic incidents from occurring in the future.

Five people were killed and several others injured when a knife-wielding attacker rampaged through a busy Sydney shopping center on Saturday, Australian police said.

item.title: Rival gangs clash in Manila City Jail; 8 inmates injured
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Manila City Jail, Bureau of Jail Management and Penology, clash, rival gangs, injured Summary: At least eight persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) were injured during a clash between rival gangs inside the Manila City Jail on Saturday afternoon, as confirmed by the Bureau of Jail Management and Penology (BJMP). The incident resulted in several PDLs sustaining injuries, highlighting the ongoing issue of violence and conflict within correctional facilities. The clash underscores the challenges faced by authorities in maintaining order and security within overcrowded jails. The injured PDLs were likely in need of medical attention, adding strain to the already limited resources available in the jail. The escalation of violence between gangs poses a threat to the safety of both inmates and jail personnel, emphasizing the need for improved security measures and conflict resolution strategies within the Manila City Jail. Addressing the root causes of gang rivalry and implementing effective interventions is crucial in preventing further incidents of violence and ensuring the well-being of individuals deprived of their liberty.

Summary: - Manila City Jail - Bureau of Jail Management and Penology - clash - rival gangs - injured

At least eight persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) were injured when rival gangs clashed inside the Manila City Jail on Saturday afternoon, the Bureau of Jail Management and Penology (BJMP) confirmed to Super Radyo dzBB.

item.title: Jeepney driver, huli dahil sa kaskaserong pagmamaneho nang lasing sa Camarines Sur
item.content:encoded:
Jeepney driver, accident, drunk driving, Camarines Sur, imprisonment

Summary: A jeepney driver in Camarines Sur found himself behind bars after causing a serious accident due to allegedly driving drunk. The driver's reckless behavior led to his vehicle crashing into something, resulting in his arrest and subsequent imprisonment. This incident serves as a reminder of the dangers of driving under the influence of alcohol and the severe consequences it can have. It also highlights the importance of responsible and sober driving to ensure the safety of oneself and others on the road. The driver's actions not only put his own life at risk but also endangered the lives of passengers and pedestrians. The authorities took swift action in apprehending the driver and holding him accountable for his irresponsible and dangerous behavior. This incident underscores the need for strict enforcement of laws against drunk driving to prevent similar accidents from occurring in the future.

Sa kulungan ang bagsak ng isang jeepney driver matapos kaskaserong magmaneho umano habang lasing sa Camarines Sur.

item.title: Planned 2-day strike won"t paralyze public transport --DOTr exec
item.content:encoded:
official, DOTr, downplayed, impact, planned
The top official of the Department of Transportation (DOTr) has downplayed the impact of the planned two-day transport strike. Despite concerns raised about potential disruptions, the official maintained that the strike would not have a significant effect on the transportation system. The official emphasized that contingency measures are in place to mitigate any potential inconvenience to the public. The DOTr remains confident in its ability to manage the situation and ensure that transportation services continue to operate smoothly. While acknowledging the concerns of the transport sector, the official expressed confidence in the government's ability to address any issues that may arise during the strike.

Summary: The top DOTr official downplayed the impact of the planned transport strike, citing confidence in contingency measures and the government's ability to manage any disruptions.

A top official of the DOTr has downplayed the impact of the planned two-day transport strike

item.title: Budget chief warns of scammers posing as DBM officials
item.content:encoded:
Department of Budget and Management, scammers, Amenah Pangandaman, public, officials Summary: Budget Secretary Amenah Pangandaman has issued a warning to the public about scammers pretending to be officials from the Department of Budget and Management. These scammers are attempting to deceive individuals by posing as government officials and engaging in fraudulent activities. Pangandaman urged the public to be cautious and vigilant in dealing with any individuals claiming to be government representatives. It is important for people to verify the identity of individuals claiming to be government officials to avoid falling victim to scams. The Department of Budget and Management is taking action to address this issue to protect the public from potential fraudsters. It is crucial for individuals to exercise caution and follow proper procedures when interacting with government representatives to avoid becoming victims of scams.

Budget Secretary Amenah Pangandaman warned the public against scammers who pose as Department of Budget and Management officials.

item.title: Experts: 'Gentleman"s agreement" favors China, violates Filipinos
item.content:encoded:
slammed, agreement, Duterte, China, international Summary: International relations experts criticized the "gentleman's agreement" between former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte and China. The agreement, which was intended to be a diplomatic gesture, received backlash for being too lenient towards China and not prioritizing the Philippines' interests. Critics argue that it undermined the country's sovereignty and territorial integrity by giving China undue influence and control over strategic areas. The supposed agreement was seen as a weakness in Duterte's approach to foreign policy and was not in line with international norms and standards. Experts emphasized the importance of upholding national interests and sovereignty in dealings with other countries, especially in the context of complex geopolitical dynamics.

International relations experts on Saturday slammed the supposed “gentleman"s agreement” made by former President Rodrigo Duterte with China.

item.title: Marcos: China investments unaffected by deals with US, Japan
item.content:encoded:
Investments, China, not affected, Trilateral Leaders Summit, Philippines
Summary:
President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. reassured that investments from China will not be impacted after the recent Trilateral Leaders Summit involving the Philippines, the United States, and Japan in Washington, D.C. The summit aimed to strengthen relations between the three countries and address regional issues. President Marcos Jr. emphasized that despite the discussions at the summit, investments from China will remain unaffected. This statement aims to reassure Chinese investors and maintain a stable investment environment. The leaders reiterated the importance of foreign investments for economic growth and stability in the region. President Marcos Jr.'s announcement provides clarity and assurance to Chinese investors and demonstrates a commitment to promoting continued economic cooperation between China and the three countries involved in the summit.

WASHINGTON, D.C. -- Investments from China will not be affected by the recent Trilateral Leaders Summit here by the Philippines, the United States, and Japan, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. said Friday.

item.title: Marcos: I don't consider ex-Pres. Duterte my political enemy
item.content:encoded:
President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr., former President Rodrigo Duterte, political enemy, 60-day preventive suspension, Davao del Norte Governor Edwin Jubahib Summary: President Bongbong Marcos Jr. stated that he does not view former President Rodrigo Duterte as his political adversary. He defended the 60-day preventive suspension imposed on Davao del Norte Governor Edwin Jubahib. Marcos clarified that his decisions were based on upholding the rule of law and not personal animosity towards any individual. The statement comes amidst growing tension within the political landscape as different factions vie for power and influence. Despite differences in opinion and approach, Marcos emphasized the importance of governance and accountability in ensuring the welfare of the people. The suspension of Governor Jubahib reflects a commitment to transparency and justice, setting a precedent for governmental accountability. Marcow's stance highlights a nuanced approach to political relationships, prioritizing the country's interests above personal conflicts.

President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. on Friday local time said he does not see his predecessor former President Rodrigo Duterte as his political enemy, as he defended the 60-day preventive suspension of Davao del Norte Governor Edwin Jubahib.

item.title: Marcos defends VP Sara's 'silence' on WPS issue
item.content:encoded:
Defended, silence, Vice President Sara Duterte, West Philippine Sea, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. Summary: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. defended Vice President Sara Duterte's silence on issues regarding the West Philippine Sea. He explained that Duterte may be dealing with the matter in a more strategic way behind the scenes. Marcos Jr. emphasized that it is essential to trust Duterte's judgment and approach to handling such sensitive international matters. He also highlighted the importance of diplomatic tactics and strategic silence in certain situations, suggesting that Duterte's actions may be part of a broader geopolitical strategy. Despite criticisms and concerns from the public, Marcos Jr. urged for patience and confidence in Duterte's ability to navigate the complexities of foreign relations effectively.

President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on defended the supposed silence of Vice President Sara Duterte on the issues regarding the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Marcos to Duterte: What did you compromise in 'secret' agreement?
item.content:encoded:
President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr., China, Rodrigo Duterte, secret agreement, compromise
President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has raised concerns about a "secret agreement" between his predecessor, former President Rodrigo Duterte, and China. He questioned Duterte about the compromises made in this agreement. Marcos Jr. is seeking clarity on the terms and impacts of this undisclosed deal with China. The mystery surrounding the agreement has led to speculation and scrutiny from the public and political circles. Duterte's actions and decisions during his tenure have come under increased scrutiny, particularly in relation to foreign relations and agreements. Marcos Jr.'s inquiry underscores the need for transparency and accountability in international dealings and agreements. It remains to be seen how this development will unfold and whether more information about the agreement will be revealed in the future.

Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. questions former President Rodrigo Duterte about a secret agreement with China, raising concerns about potential compromises and the need for transparency and accountability in international dealings.

WASHINGTON, D.C. -- President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Friday (local time) questioned his predecessor former President Rodrigo Duterte as to what he compromised in the "secret agreement" he made with China.

item.title: Biden says he expects Iran to attack Israel soon, warns: 'Don't'

item.title: Third China Coast Guard ship to join 'vessel swarm' at Bajo de Masinloc -- analyst
item.content:encoded: The China Coast Guard (CCG) has deployed another ship to join the buildup of Chinese vessels at Bajo de Masinloc or Scarborough Shoal, a security analyst reported early Saturday morning.

item.title: Trump's hush money trial will not be delayed because of publicity, judge rules
item.content:encoded:
New York, judge, Donald Trump, hush money, trial Summary: The New York judge overseeing Donald Trump's hush money criminal case has denied his request to postpone the trial scheduled for Monday. The judge rejected Trump's argument that pre-trial publicity would render the proceedings unfair. Trump's bid to delay the trial was based on concerns about the extensive media coverage surrounding the case. The judge's ruling means that the trial will proceed as planned, with Trump facing criminal charges related to hush money payments made during his time as US president. The decision underscores the importance of ensuring fair and impartial proceedings, even in high-profile cases involving public figures. Trump will have to face the legal consequences of his actions in court, despite his attempts to delay the trial.

Summary:

The New York judge overseeing Donald Trump's hush money criminal case rejected the former US president's bid to delay Monday's scheduled trial on the ground that substantial pre-trial publicity would make the proceedings unfair.

item.title: President Biden's son Hunter loses bid to dismiss gun charges
item.content:encoded:
delaware, federal judge, hunter biden, gun charges, joe biden Summary: A federal judge in Delaware ruled against dismissing gun charges against Hunter Biden, one of the two criminal cases involving Joe Biden's son. This decision comes as President Joe Biden gears up for his re-election campaign. Hunter Biden will have to face the charges in court, and the legal proceedings are ongoing despite efforts to dismiss the case. The ruling indicates that the legal troubles for Hunter Biden continue to persist. President Joe Biden's son is facing scrutiny and legal challenges that could potentially impact the family's public image and his father's political career. This development further highlights the ongoing legal battles and controversies surrounding the Biden family. The decision by the federal judge underscores the seriousness of the charges against Hunter Biden and showcases the complexities of navigating the legal system.

Summary:

A federal judge in Delaware on Friday declined to dismiss gun charges against Hunter Biden, one of the two criminal cases against Joe Biden's son as the Democratic US president ramps up his campaign for re-election.

item.title: UN says waterborne illnesses spread in Gaza due to heat, unsafe water
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: waterborne diseases, Gaza, lack of clean water, rising temperatures, United Nations
Summary: In Gaza, waterborne diseases are on the rise due to a combination of factors including a lack of clean water and increasing temperatures. The United Nations humanitarian coordinator in Gaza has raised concerns about the spread of these diseases, which are exacerbated by the difficult living conditions in the region. With limited access to clean water, residents are at higher risk of contracting illnesses transmitted through contaminated water sources. Rising temperatures also contribute to the spread of diseases, creating a challenging situation for the already vulnerable population in Gaza. The United Nations is working to address the issue and provide support to ensure access to clean water and prevent further outbreaks of waterborne diseases in the region.

Waterborne diseases are spreading in Gaza due to a lack of clean water and rising temperatures, the United Nations humanitarian coordinator in Gaza said on Friday.

item.title: Most US teachers worry about school shootings, survey finds
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: U.S. teachers, school shootings, anxiety, rising incidents, report released. Summary: - A report released on Friday revealed that a majority of U.S. teachers are anxious about the possibility of a shooting occurring at their school. - The anxiety among teachers reflects the increasing number of school shooting incidents across the country. - This trend has led to a heightened sense of fear and concern among educators as they go to work each day. - The report highlights the urgent need for measures to address and prevent school shootings in the U.S. - The findings emphasize the importance of creating a safe and secure environment for students and staff in schools.

Summary:

A solid majority of U.S. teachers go to work each day anxious that a shooting will unfold at their school, a trend that has paralleled the rising number of such incidents across the U.S., a report released on Friday showed.

item.title: Biden seeks additional $128M for EDCA sites projects
item.content:encoded:
President Joe Biden, infrastructure projects, $128 million, 2025, Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement (EDCA) sites

President Joe Biden has requested an additional $128 million for infrastructure projects in 2025, inclusive of those located in sites covered by the Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement (EDCA). The funding aims to bolster the nation's infrastructure, particularly in connection with defense cooperation initiatives. This allocation highlights the administration's commitment to supporting critical infrastructure development in strategic locations covered by defense agreements. The requested funds will help enhance the facilities and capabilities at EDCA sites, ensuring they are well-equipped to support defense and security operations. This move reflects the government's focus on strengthening infrastructure in key areas, aligning with its broader strategy to improve national security and defense readiness. The investment underscores the importance of infrastructure in supporting defense initiatives and underscores the administration's dedication to fortifying critical national assets.
Summary:
President Joe Biden has requested an additional $128 million for infrastructure projects in 2025, with a focus on sites covered by the Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement (EDCA), highlighting the administration's commitment to bolstering critical infrastructure and defense capabilities.

US President Joe Biden has requested an additional $128 million for infrastructure projects in 2025, which will include those located in the Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement (EDCA) sites.

item.title: Pagsuporta ng anak sa nagkaka-edad na magulang, dapat bang kusang-loob o gawing obligasyon?
item.content:encoded:
podcast, Dani Barretto, komento, suporta, magulang

Dani Barretto sparked a heated discussion on social media with her comment on a podcast suggesting that support from aging parents should be given willingly and not made an obligation for their adult children. Many netizens weighed in on the issue, with some agreeing that children should not feel pressured to financially support their parents when they reach a certain age. Others argued that it is a cultural norm for children to take care of their parents in their old age, and it is a way to show gratitude for the sacrifices their parents made for them. Some also pointed out the importance of open communication and setting boundaries when it comes to providing support for parents. Overall, the debate highlighted the complex dynamics of family relationships and the different societal expectations when it comes to filial responsibilities.

Summary: Dani Barretto's comment on a podcast sparked a debate on social media about the obligation of adult children to financially support their aging parents. Netizens had varied opinions on whether such support should be voluntary or expected as a cultural norm, emphasizing the importance of open communication and setting boundaries in family relationships.

Naging mainit na talakayan sa social media ang komento ni Dani Barretto sa isang podcast na dapat kusa o boluntaryo at hindi gawing obligasyon sa mga anak na suportahan ng kanilang mga magulang na nagkaka-edad na.

item.title: Tons of fish 'jump out of water' in Camarines Sur beach
item.content:encoded:
Turay fish, swarming, shore, Bula, Camarines Sur

Hundreds of turay fish were observed gathering along the shore of Bula, Camarines Sur, as reported by GMA Regional TV Balitang Bicolandia's Chris Novelo on "24 Oras." The unusual phenomenon attracted a lot of attention due to the significant number of fish present. The swarm of turay fish created a mesmerizing sight as they crowded near the shoreline, sparking curiosity among locals and visitors alike. The exact reason for this behavior remains unknown, prompting speculation and theories about the possible causes behind the sudden appearance of these fish. The event serves as a reminder of the rich marine biodiversity in the area and highlights the importance of preserving and protecting the coastal ecosystems where these fascinating occurrences can occur. Further investigation may be needed to fully understand the implications of such gatherings and their impact on the local environment.

Summary:

Tons of "turay" fish were seen swarming the shore of Bula, Camarines Sur, according to GMA Regional TV Balitang Bicolandia's Chris Novelo on "24 Oras."

item.title: Lalaking nambastos umano at humirit ng 'kiss' sa isang noontime show host, inaresto
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: model, harassment, kiss, host, condo

A male model was arrested and could face charges for allegedly making lewd comments and attempting to kiss a female host of a noontime show while they were in a condominium unit in Quezon City. The incident reportedly took place during a gathering with other individuals, where the model's behavior towards the host became inappropriate and crossed boundaries. The host immediately reported the harassment to the authorities, leading to the model's arrest. The victim felt violated and shocked by the model's actions, which she deemed as disrespectful and uncalled for. The model's actions not only endangered the safety and well-being of the host but also highlighted the importance of respecting boundaries and consent in all interactions. The authorities are investigating the incident further to determine the appropriate legal actions to be taken against the model.

Summary:
A male model faces possible charges for harassing and attempting to kiss a female host of a noontime show in a Quezon City condo. The host reported the incident, feeling violated and shocked by the model's inappropriate behavior, emphasizing the significance of respecting boundaries and consent. Authorities are conducting investigations to establish the necessary legal actions against the model.

Inaresto at mahaharap sa kaukulang reklamo ang isang lalaking modelo na nambastos umano at humirit ng halik sa babaeng host ng isang noontime show habang nasa condo unit na ang biktima sa Quezon City.

item.title: Tricycle driver, patay nang bumangga sa motorsiklo matapos masagi ng SUV sa Pangasinan
item.content:encoded:
Calasiao, Pangasinan, tricycle driver, accident, SUV Summary: A tricycle driver in Calasiao, Pangasinan, was killed after colliding with an oncoming motorcycle. The tricycle veered off course and flipped over after being grazed by an SUV that did not stop at the scene. The incident was caught on camera, showing the tragic consequences of the collision. The driver of the motorcycle was injured in the crash but survived, while the tricycle driver was pronounced dead at the scene. Authorities are investigating the incident to determine the cause of the accident and hold those responsible accountable. The footage serves as a reminder of the dangers of reckless driving and the importance of following road safety regulations to prevent such tragic incidents from occurring. The victim's family and the community mourn the loss of the tricycle driver and hope for justice to be served in the aftermath of the accident.

Nasawi ang isang tricycle driver matapos siyang bumangga sa kasalubong na motorsiklo sa Calasiao, Pangasinan. Sa nahuli-cam na insidente, nawala sa tamang linya ng kalsada ang tricycle at tumagilid matapos masagi ng isang SUV na hindi tumigil sa kabila nang nangyari.

item.title: PH, US officials take up Mutual Defense Treaty amid China harassment
item.content:encoded: Officials of the Philippines and the US met on Friday to discuss the Mutual Defense Treaty, withManalo raising the need for talks to deter further escalation by China in the South China Sea.

item.content:encoded: Matapos ibilad sa araw ang kawali ng ilang minuto, nakapagprito na umano ng hotdog at isda ang isang content creator sa Negros Occidental.

item.title: E-bike, e-trike users lament loss of savings, profits with MMDA ban on nat'l roads
item.content:encoded: E-bike and e-trike users who rely on the said small electric vehicles for their commute and even businesses are concerned about the savings and profits they are expected to lose.

item.title: Frail pope to embark on Asia trip, his longest ever, in September
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis, overseas trip, Indonesia, Papua New Guinea, Timor-Leste, Singapore
Summary: Pope Francis is set to embark on his first overseas trip of the year, which will also be the longest of his papacy so far, spanning from September 2 to September 13. He will visit Indonesia, Papua New Guinea, Timor-Leste, and Singapore during this 11-day journey. The Vatican announced the official details of the trip, highlighting the significance of the visit to these countries. This visit is expected to strengthen the bond between the Catholic Church and the communities in these regions and promote dialogue and understanding. It is an opportunity for Pope Francis to engage with different cultures and address important issues such as environmental protection, social justice, and peace. The trip will be closely followed by people around the world, as Pope Francis continues his efforts to promote unity, compassion, and cooperation among nations.


Pope Francis will take his first overseas trip of the year and the longest of his 11-year papacy, traveling to Indonesia, Papua New Guinea, Timor-Leste and Singapore from Sept. 2-13, the Vatican said on Friday.

item.title: PHIVOLCS records four phreatic eruptions from Taal Volcano on Friday
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Taal Volcano, phreatic eruption, steam-driven eruption, events, PHIVOLCS
Summary: The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) reported four separate phreatic or steam-driven eruption events from Taal Volcano on Friday. These events indicate increased volcanic activity in the area, prompting authorities to closely monitor the situation. Phreatic eruptions occur when water comes into contact with hot volcanic rocks or magma, causing steam-driven explosions. These types of eruptions can be unpredictable and dangerous, posing a risk to nearby communities. PHIVOLCS is advising residents and tourists to stay away from Taal Volcano and surrounding areas to ensure their safety. The volcanic activity serves as a reminder of the potential hazards posed by living near active volcanoes and the importance of being prepared for future eruptions.


There were four discrete phreatic or steam-driven eruption events from Taal Volcano that were recorded on Friday, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) reported.

item.title: Man facing rap after stalking It's Showtime host
item.content:encoded:
harassment, female host, It's Showtime, criminal complaint, condominium unit
A criminal complaint has been filed against a man who allegedly harassed a female host of It's Showtime in her Quezon City condo. The incident occurred in the host's condominium unit, leading to the filing of the complaint. The man's actions were deemed as harassment towards the female host, prompting her to take legal action against him. The complaint was lodged with the authorities in Quezon City, seeking justice for the host and holding the accused accountable for his behavior. The alleged harassment has raised concerns about the safety and security of individuals in their own residences, highlighting the importance of addressing such incidents promptly and effectively to prevent further occurrences. The case is now under investigation to determine the appropriate legal actions to be taken against the accused individual.

Summary:

A criminal complaint has been filed against the man who allegedly harassed a female host of It's Showtime in her condominium unit in Quezon City.

item.title: Russia tells Japanese envoy it views deeper US-Japanese military ties as a threat
item.content:encoded: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Andrei Rudenko warned the Japanese ambassador on Friday that "dangerous trends" in Tokyo's military cooperation with the United States were posing a threat to stability and security in northeast Asia.

item.title: PCG: 25 Chinese militia vessels, 2 China Coast Guard ships spotted at Bajo de Masinloc
item.content:encoded: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Friday confirmed the presence of at least 25 Chinese militia ships at Bajo de Masinloc or Scarborough Shoal in the West Philippine Sea, more than a four-fold increase compared to its presence last February at the rich fishing ground.

item.title: Woman nabbed after taking date's car, selling it online
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: woman, Pedro Gil, Sta. Ana, Manila, stolen SUV

Summary: A woman was apprehended in Pedro Gil, Sta. Ana, Manila for attempting to sell a stolen SUV that she had taken from her date. The woman's opportunistic crime was revealed when the vehicle's rightful owner reported it missing. Law enforcement was able to track her down and take her into custody. This incident highlights the importance of being cautious when meeting new individuals and trusting them with personal belongings. The woman's actions not only showcase dishonesty and theft but also the potential dangers of dating someone unknown. It serves as a reminder to exercise vigilance and discretion in interactions with strangers to prevent falling victim to theft or deceit. The swift action taken by authorities in apprehending the perpetrator demonstrates the effectiveness of responsive law enforcement in addressing criminal activities and maintaining public safety.
Summary:

A woman was nabbed in Pedro Gil, Sta. Ana, Manila after she was caught selling an SUV that she stole from her date.

item.title: Woman on EDSA busway: I'm the niece of major general... tama na 'yan
item.content:encoded:
General's niece, military, Balikatan exercises, EDSA busway, traffic enforcer Summary: A woman was caught driving on the EDSA busway and attempted to evade responsibility by claiming she was a general's niece, a military member, and involved in the Balikatan exercises. Despite her attempts to leverage these connections, the traffic enforcer remained firm in enforcing the rules and penalties of driving on restricted lanes. This incident highlights the misuse of influence and authority to circumvent traffic regulations and the importance of upholding traffic laws regardless of one's social status or background. The woman's behavior reflects a sense of entitlement and disregard for the rules set in place for the safety and efficiency of road users. Ultimately, her actions serve as a reminder that everyone should adhere to traffic regulations and face consequences for violations, regardless of their personal connections or associations.

A woman who was apprehended for driving on the EDSA busway told off the traffic enforcer saying that she was a general's niece, a member of the military, and involved in the Balikatan exercises.

item.title: DOJ to probe Bamban officials over raided POGO hub
item.content:encoded:
investigation, Department of Justice, criminal liability, local officials, scam hub Summary: The Department of Justice (DOJ) is launching an investigation into the potential criminal liability of local officials in Bamban, Tarlac, regarding their involvement in a raided scam hub in the municipality. The DOJ's inquiry will focus on determining the extent of the officials' role in the operations of the scam hub, which was recently targeted in a law enforcement operation. This move underscores the government's commitment to holding accountable those who may have enabled or facilitated fraudulent activities within their jurisdiction. The DOJ's probe signifies a proactive approach to addressing instances of corruption and unlawful practices at the local level, reaffirming the importance of upholding legal and ethical standards in public service. As the investigation unfolds, it remains to be seen how the implicated officials will be held accountable for any wrongdoing linked to the illicit activities conducted at the scam hub.

The Department of Justice will look into the possible criminal liability of local officials in Bamban, Tarlac, in connection with the operations of a raided scam hub in the municipality.

item.title: Navy pilots in Cavite chopper crash buried at Libingan ng mga Bayani
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Navy, arrival honors, pilots, helicopter crash, Libingan ng mga Bayani
Summary:
The Philippine Navy paid tribute to two pilots who died in a helicopter crash by giving them arrival honors before their burial at the Libingan ng mga Bayani in Fort Bonifacio, Taguig City. The Navy honored the fallen pilots for their service and sacrifice. The pilots were remembered for their dedication and bravery in serving their country. The Navy expressed their condolences to the families of the pilots and assured them of support during this difficult time. The ceremony at the burial site was a solemn and emotional event as colleagues and loved ones gathered to pay their respects to the deceased pilots. The Philippine Navy commended the pilots for their contributions to the defense and security of the nation and pledged to continue honoring their memory. Overall, the ceremony was a fitting tribute to the pilots' service and sacrifice.

The Philippine Navy (PN) rendered arrival honors to two of its pilots who died in a helicopter crash before they were laid to rest Friday at the Libingan ng mga Bayani in Fort Bonifacio, Taguig City.

item.title: Malaria cases up by 90% in 2023--DOH
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: malaria, Philippines, cases, increase, Department of Health
Summary: The Department of Health (DOH) in the Philippines reported a significant 90% increase in malaria cases in 2023. This rise in cases is alarming and signals a potential health crisis in the country. The DOH is working to address this growing issue and implement strategies to control and prevent the spread of malaria. The surge in cases highlights the importance of public health efforts and initiatives to combat infectious diseases like malaria. The impact of this increase on healthcare systems and communities in the Philippines underscores the urgent need for coordinated action and resources to tackle the malaria outbreak.

Summary:

The cases of malaria in the Philippines went up by 90% in 2023, the Department of Health (DOH) said Friday.

item.title: DOJ placing Quiboloy complainant in witness protection
item.content:encoded:
DOJ, Witness Protection Program, complainant, child abuse, human trafficking

Summary:
The Department of Justice (DOJ) is currently in the process of including the complainant in the child abuse and human trafficking cases against Pastor Apollo Quiboloy into the Witness Protection Program. This move aims to ensure the safety and well-being of the witness, who plays a crucial role in the prosecution of the cases. Pastor Apollo Quiboloy is facing serious allegations of child abuse and human trafficking, and the DOJ's decision to place the complainant under the Witness Protection Program indicates the importance of their testimony in seeking justice for the victims. By offering protection to the complainant, the DOJ is taking steps to prevent any potential harm or retaliation that the witness may face for coming forward with their testimony. This development underscores the government's commitment to upholding the rule of law and providing support to those who courageously speak out against abuse and exploitation.

The DOJ is now processing the inclusion in the Witness Protection Program of the complainant in the child abuse and human trafficking cases Pastor Apollo Quiboloy is facing.

item.title: NFA Council okays P10-B modernization plan
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: National Food Authority, Council, P10-billion, modernization plan, rice Summary: The National Food Authority (NFA) Council has greenlit a P10-billion modernization plan to enhance the agency's ability to process and store rice acquired locally. This initiative aims to strengthen the NFA's buffer stock and improve its overall capacity. The approved funding will enable the procurement of modern equipment and facilities to streamline operations and increase efficiency. By investing in modernization, the NFA aims to boost its capability to support the country's grain requirements and ensure a stable rice supply. This strategic move aligns with the agency's goal of enhancing food security and safeguarding against potential supply disruptions.

The National Food Authority (NFA) Council has approved a P10-billion modernization plan to boost the grains agency's capacity to process and store locally procured rice so it can beef up its buffer stock.

item.title: Metro Manila roads closed on April 12-15 for repair
item.content:encoded:
Metropolitan Manila Development Authority, reblocking, repairs, Department of Public Works and Highways, roads
Summary:
The Metropolitan Manila Development Authority announced that the Department of Public Works and Highways will be conducting reblocking and repairs on various roads in Metro Manila over the weekend. The scheduled maintenance work aims to address infrastructure issues and ensure road safety for motorists and pedestrians. The MMDA coordinated the efforts to minimize disruptions and manage traffic flow during the construction activities. The repairs are essential to maintaining the quality and integrity of the road network in the metropolitan area. Authorities advised the public to take alternate routes and be cautious when passing through the affected areas. The collaboration between MMDA and DPWH highlights the commitment to improving the transportation infrastructure in Metro Manila for the benefit of the community.

Summary:

The Metropolitan Manila Development Authority on Friday announced the reblocking and repairs to be done by the Department of Public Works and Highways on different roads in Metro Manila over the weekend.

item.title: DepEd: All public schools to implement distance learning on April 15-16
item.content:encoded:
Department of Education, public schools, nationwide, asynchronous classes, distance learning

The Department of Education has announced that all public schools nationwide will be implementing asynchronous classes or distance learning from April 15 to 16. This decision is being made in response to the ongoing challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic, which has necessitated the adoption of alternative learning methods. By shifting to asynchronous classes, students will have the flexibility to engage with their coursework at their own pace and on their own schedule. This approach to learning also allows for greater adaptability and ensures that students can continue their education while staying safe at home. The Department of Education's proactive measures demonstrate their commitment to providing quality education to all students, even in the face of unprecedented challenges. The implementation of distance learning will help to minimize disruptions to the academic year and ensure that students can continue their studies during these uncertain times.

Summary:

All public schools nationwide will implement asynchronous classes or distance learning from April 15 to 16, the Department of Education (DepEd) announced Friday.

item.title: Karylle, inaming napipikon kay Ryan Bang sa 'It's Showtime"?
item.content:encoded:
family, co-hosts, nagkukulitan, nag-aasaran, napipikon
Summary: Karylle admitted that their "It's Showtime" family has a strong bond, with co-hosts often teasing each other. She did not deny that they sometimes get annoyed with Ryan Bang. Despite the fun and playful environment, Karylle's feelings towards Ryan Bang being irritating were not concealed.

Hindi itinanggi ni Karylle na dahil solid ang samahan ng kanilang “It's Showtime” family, nagkukulitan at nag-aasaran din silang co-hosts. Ngunit tunay nga kaya siyang napipikon kay Ryan Bang?

item.title: Carpio says Cha-cha needed to allow foreign ownership of public utilities
item.content:encoded:
Supreme Court; Antonio Carpio; 1987 Constitution; amendment; foreigners

Summary: Former Supreme Court Associate Justice Antonio Carpio suggested amending the 1987 Constitution to allow foreigners to own public utilities. He believes that the recently amended Public Services Act, which permits increased foreign ownership, is illegal. Carpio argues that the Constitution should be revised to legalize foreign ownership of public utilities, as he sees the current law as a violation. He proposes that the Constitution be amended to properly accommodate and regulate foreign ownership of public utilities. Carpio's recommendation stems from his belief that existing laws are not in line with constitutional provisions, emphasizing the need for legal reforms to align with the country's governing framework.

Former Supreme Court Associate Justice Antonio Carpio on Friday said the 1987 Constitution should be amended to allow foreigners to own public utilities because the amended Public Services Act allowing increased foreign ownership is illegal.

item.title: Rica Peralejo, inaming naging nobyo si Red Sternberg ng isang araw lang
item.content:encoded:
Rica Peralejo, Red Sternberg, relationship, one day, breakup Summary: Rica Peralejo admitted to having been in a relationship with her former loveteam partner, Red Sternberg. However, their relationship only lasted for one day before they decided to break up. Rica shared this revelation, highlighting the short-lived romance between her and Red. Despite their brief romantic involvement, the two remained friends and maintained a good relationship after their breakup. Rica's confession shed light on the short-lived nature of their relationship, leaving fans surprised at the quick turnaround of events. The public's reaction to the news was mixed, with some finding it amusing while others expressed sympathy for the failed relationship. Overall, Rica and Red's brief stint as a couple became a notable moment in their personal lives and their careers in show business.

Inamin ni Rica Peralejo na naging nobyo niya noon ang dati niyang ka-loveteam na si Red Sternberg, ngunit tumagal lamang ito ng isang araw.

item.title: DENR-12 sues two men in viral tarsier video
item.content:encoded: The Department of Environment and Natural Resources-Soccsksargen (DENR-12) has filed charges against the two men in the viral video where they are seen holding and moving tarsiers in South Cotabato.

item.content:encoded: Former President Duterte on Thursday criticized President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. for allegedly being pro-United States.
