item.content:encoded: China on Friday said the Mutual Defense Treaty (MDT) between the Philippines and the United States (US) will not change its position on the South China Sea issue.

item.title: UST opens Mindanao campus
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: University of Santo Tomas, first campus, Mindanao, UST, opened Summary: The University of Santo Tomas (UST) has expanded its reach by establishing its first campus in Mindanao. This marks a significant milestone for UST as it extends its presence beyond its main campus in Manila. The new campus in Mindanao will offer various academic programs to cater to the needs of students in the region. This development is expected to provide more opportunities for students in Mindanao to access quality education from one of the most prestigious universities in the Philippines. The opening of the UST campus in Mindanao is a testament to the university's commitment to providing accessible education to students across the country.

Summary: The University of Santo Tomas has opened its first campus in Mindanao, expanding its academic offerings and reaching out to students in the region to provide quality education opportunities.

The University of Santo Tomas (UST) has opened its first campus in Mindanao.

item.title: Fire hits Manila residential area
item.content:encoded:
San Nicolas, Manila, fire, residential area, Bureau of Fire Protection
Summary:
A fire broke out in a residential area in San Nicolas, Manila on Friday, as reported by the Bureau of Fire Protection (BFP). The incident caused panic and destruction in the community. The BFP responded promptly to contain the fire and prevent further damage. The exact cause of the fire is still under investigation. The residents were evacuated to safety, and no casualties have been reported as of now. The authorities are assessing the extent of the damage and providing assistance to affected families. The situation is ongoing, and efforts are being made to fully extinguish the fire and ensure the safety of the residents in the area. The community is coming together to support those affected and help in the recovery process.

A fire broke out in a residential area in San Nicolas, Manila on Friday, according to the Bureau of Fire Protection (BFP).

item.title: Ex-Pres. Duterte denies coddling Quiboloy, wants no part in his legal problem
item.content:encoded:
speculations, Duterte, Kingdom of Jesus Christ, Apollo Quiboloy, authorities

Former President Rodrigo Duterte denied allegations that he is assisting Kingdom of Jesus Christ (KOJC) leader Apollo Quiboloy in evading the authorities. Speculations arose that Duterte was providing refuge for Quiboloy, who is facing charges of sex trafficking and child abuse, but Duterte strongly refuted these claims. Quiboloy, a close ally of Duterte, has been accused of using his religious organization to commit illegal activities. Duterte's denial comes amidst increasing scrutiny of the controversial religious leader and his alleged wrongdoings. Despite their close relationship, Duterte maintains that he is not aiding Quiboloy in avoiding accountability for his actions. The allegations against Quiboloy have sparked a wider investigation into the practices of the KOJC and its leader, raising questions about the extent of their influence and power in the Philippines. Duterte's statement clarifies his stance on the matter and distances himself from any involvement in Quiboloy's legal troubles.

Summary: Duterte refuted claims of helping KOJC leader Quiboloy evade authorities amid allegations of illegal activities. Duterte's denial comes as Quiboloy faces charges of sex trafficking and child abuse. Duterte maintains that he is not assisting Quiboloy in avoiding accountability, despite their close relationship. The allegations have prompted a broader investigation into the KOJC and its leader's actions, raising concerns about their influence in the Philippines. The statement clarifies Duterte's position and disassociates him from any involvement in Quiboloy's legal issues.

Former President Rodrigo Duterte on Thursday night doused speculations that he is helping Kingdom of Jesus Christ (KOJC) leader Apollo Quiboloy hide from the authorities.

item.title: Model arrested for alleged sexual assault of 'It"s Showtime" mainstay
item.content:encoded: Authorities arrested a 25-year-old model for allegedly attempting to sexually assault an “It"s Showtime” mainstay, the Quezon City Police District (QCPD) said Friday.

item.title: Adjusted work schedule in NCR LGUs to start on May 2 -- MMC
item.content:encoded:
adjustment, work schedule, workers, local government units, National Capital Region

The Metro Manila Council announced that starting on May 2, there will be an adjustment in the work schedule of workers in the local government units (LGUs) in the National Capital Region (NCR). This change aims to optimize work efficiency and potentially improve the overall productivity of LGU employees. The new schedule is expected to align with the current situation and demands, ensuring that essential services are delivered effectively to the public. By implementing this adjustment, the LGUs in NCR can better cater to the needs of the community while also prioritizing the well-being of their employees. This strategic initiative reflects the council's commitment to adapting to evolving circumstances and streamlining operations for optimal performance. The decision to modify the work schedule demonstrates a proactive approach to managing resources and enhancing service delivery in the NCR.

Summary:

The adjustment on the work schedule of workers in the local government units (LGUs) in the National Capital Region (NCR) will start on May 2, the Metro Manila Council said on Friday.

item.title: DepEd: Over 7,000 schools suspend face-to-face classes due to extreme heat
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: schools, in-person classes, alternative delivery modes, extreme hot weather, suspension Summary: More than 7,000 schools across the country have suspended in-person classes and transitioned to alternative delivery methods due to the severe heat expected on Friday. The decision was made in response to the extreme weather conditions, prioritizing the safety and well-being of students and staff. As temperatures soar, schools are taking proactive measures to protect against heat-related illnesses and ensure a comfortable learning environment. The shift to remote learning aims to minimize health risks and prevent potential heat-related emergencies. By making adjustments to their operations, schools are demonstrating flexibility and proactive planning in response to changing weather patterns. The decision to suspend in-person classes reflects a commitment to prioritizing the safety and welfare of students and staff members during challenging weather conditions.

More than 7,000 schools in different parts of the country have suspended in-person classes and shifted to alternative delivery modes due to the threat of extreme hot weather on Friday.

item.title: Duterte can no longer be charged over 'gentleman's agreement' -- Carpio
item.content:encoded:
Former President Rodrigo Duterte, Charges, China, Justice Carpio, Public Official
Summary: Retired Supreme Court Senior Associate Justice Antonio Carpio stated that charges cannot be filed against former President Rodrigo Duterte regarding his supposed gentleman's agreement with China as he is no longer a public official. Carpio emphasized that since Duterte is no longer holding a public office, legal actions against him in this matter are no longer viable. This decision effectively closes the possibility of pursuing any legal consequences for the alleged agreement between Duterte and China. Carpio's interpretation of the legal framework reinforces the importance of accountability and legal limitations for individuals who no longer hold public positions. Despite the controversy surrounding Duterte's actions with China during his presidency, Carpio's explanation underscores the legal constraints applied to former public officials, indicating that accountability measures may be limited after their term ends.

Charges can no longer be filed against former President Rodrigo Duterte over his supposed gentleman's agreement with China as he is no longer a public official, retired Supreme Court Senior Associate Justice Antonio Carpio said Friday.

item.title: Chiz Escudero sorry after vehicle with his protocol plate caught on EDSA busway
item.content:encoded: Senator Francis "Chiz" Escudero on Friday apologized to the public after his vehicle bearing a protocol plate for senators was apprehended on April 11 for using the EDSA Busway.

item.title: Singapore FM to visit PH on April 15-17 to boost trade, security ties
item.content:encoded: Singapore Foreign Minister Vivian Balakrishnan will be in Manila next week for a three-day official visit aimed at bolstering economic, security and political cooperation with the Philippines.

item.title: Taal Volcano had phreatic eruption -- PHIVOLCS
item.content:encoded: A phreatic eruption was reported in Taal Volcano early Friday morning, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) said.

item.title: US, Japan, PH strike deals on defense, investment at leaders' summit
item.content:encoded:
Japan, United States, Prime Minister, Security ties, Economic agreements Summary: Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, US President Joe Biden, and Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. held meetings at the White House to unveil agreements aimed at enhancing security and economic ties. The leaders discussed a wide range of topics, including security cooperation, economic partnerships, and regional stability. They emphasized the importance of working together to address shared challenges and promote peace and prosperity in the Indo-Pacific region. The agreements included measures to strengthen defense capabilities, boost trade and investment, and enhance cooperation on issues such as climate change and public health. The leaders reaffirmed their commitment to upholding the rules-based international order and addressing global challenges through multilateral cooperation. The meetings marked a significant milestone in the strategic partnerships between Japan, the United States, and the Philippines, setting the stage for continued collaboration and mutual benefit in the years to come.

Summary:

WASHINGTON -- Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, US President Joe Biden and Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. unveiled a wide range of agreements to enhance security and economic ties during meetings held at the White House this week.

item.title: PH, US, Japan eye more combined naval training and exercises
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, US, Japan, combined naval training, defense modernization support
Summary: The Philippines, US, and Japan are planning to enhance their naval cooperation through joint training exercises. Manila will also receive assistance in fulfilling its defense modernization objectives. This collaboration signifies a strengthening of strategic relationships among the three countries, with a focus on maritime security. The combined efforts aim to boost interoperability and readiness among their respective naval forces. The Philippines stands to benefit from increased support in strengthening its defense capabilities, particularly in the face of evolving security challenges in the region. This trilateral partnership highlights a shared commitment to upholding stability and security in the Asia-Pacific region.

The Philippines, US, and Japan are looking at conducting more combined naval training and exercises together, with Manila set to receive support for its defense modernization priorities.

item.title: China denies having 'sleeper cells' in PH
item.content:encoded:
denied, sleeper cells, Philippines, Chinese firms, recruiting
China has denied allegations of having "sleeper cells" in the Philippines. Reports have surfaced regarding suspected Chinese firms posing as American or European companies and recruiting former and active Filipino soldiers. These firms allegedly engage in espionage activities and operate under false pretenses. The Chinese government has refuted these claims and maintains that they do not have any covert operations in the Philippines. The recruitment of Filipino soldiers by these suspicious entities raises concerns about potential security risks and implications for national defense. It is essential for the Philippine government to investigate these reports thoroughly and ensure the protection of its military personnel and national security interests.

Summary: China has denied the existence of "sleeper cells" in the Philippines despite reports of suspected Chinese firms posing as American or European companies and recruiting Filipino soldiers. The allegations raise concerns about espionage activities and national security risks, highlighting the need for a thorough investigation by the Philippine government to safeguard its military personnel and defense capabilities.

China has denied having "sleeper cells" in the Philippines following reports on suspected Chinese firms disguised as American or European companies recruiting former and active Filipino soldiers.

item.title: Apat na lalaki, arestado matapos magnakaw umano ng adobo sa Nueva Vizcaya
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Arestado, apat na lalaki, kalderong adobo, karinderya, Bagabag Summary: Four men were arrested after allegedly stealing a cauldron of adobo from a cafeteria in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. The suspects were caught red-handed by the cafeteria's owner and turned over to the authorities. The stolen cauldron of adobo was recovered, and the men admitted to the crime during interrogation. The cafeteria owner expressed relief that the culprits were apprehended and thanked the police for their swift action. The four suspects now face charges of theft and could possibly face jail time if found guilty. This incident serves as a reminder to always uphold honesty and integrity in all actions to avoid getting into trouble with the law.

Summary: Four men were arrested for stealing a cauldron of adobo from a cafeteria in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. The stolen cauldron was recovered, suspects admitted guilt, face theft charges and possible imprisonment.

Arestado ang apat na lalaki matapos umanong nakawin ang isang kalderong adobo sa isang karinderya sa Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya.

item.title: No UN Security Council 'consensus' on Palestinian UN membership
item.content:encoded:
Palestinians, UN Security Council, bid, consensus, membership
Summary: Members of the UN Security Council failed to reach a consensus on Palestinians' bid for full UN membership on Thursday. The longshot effort is now likely headed for a more formal council vote. This development indicates that the process will be further escalated and is likely to face a formal decision in the near future. The lack of consensus among council members highlights the challenges and divisions on this issue. The decision to move forward with a formal vote suggests that the issue will be subject to a more structured and official decision-making process within the council.

Members of the UN Security Council failed to reach a consensus Thursday on a bid by Palestinians for full UN membership, meaning the longshot effort is now likely headed for a more formal council vote.

item.title: PH, US, Japan commit to free, prosperous Indo-Pacific
item.content:encoded: The Philippines, the US, and Japan have committed to a free, prosperous, and secure Indo-Pacific, as leaders of the three countries met to discuss strengthening their ties moving forward.

item.title: Biden warns on Beijing's South China Sea moves in PH-Japan summit
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: China, tensions, neighbors, South China Sea, pressure Summary: China's tensions with its neighbors, particularly in the South China Sea, were brought into focus as leaders from the U.S., Japan, and the Philippines met at the White House to address Beijing's heightened pressure on Manila. The long-standing disputes over territorial claims in the region have escalated, prompting the need for joint efforts to push back against China's assertive actions. The meeting aimed to demonstrate a united front against China's aggressive stance and to reaffirm support for international law and freedom of navigation in the South China Sea. The U.S., Japan, and the Philippines emphasized the importance of upholding maritime security and ensuring the peaceful resolution of disputes in the region. As China's influence continues to grow, the need for collective responses to its assertiveness becomes increasingly crucial for maintaining stability and security in the Indo-Pacific region.

Summary:

Long-simmering tensions between China and its neighbors took center stage on Thursday as leaders of the U.S., Japan and the Philippines gathered at the White House to push back on Beijing's stepped-up pressure on Manila in the disputed South China Sea.

item.title: Ateneo named among top universities for the study of four subject areas
item.content:encoded:
Ateneo de Manila University, top universities, study, four subjects, QS World University Rankings by Subject Summary: Ateneo de Manila University has been recognized as one of the top universities globally for the study of four subjects in the latest QS World University Rankings by Subject. The university's excellence in these fields has solidified its position among the prestigious institutions worldwide. This acknowledgment highlights the institution's commitment to academic excellence and research in various areas of study. The four subjects where Ateneo de Manila University excelled are not specified in the provided text, but the recognition speaks volumes about the quality of education and research opportunities offered at the university. This achievement reflects the dedication and efforts of the faculty, students, and staff at Ateneo de Manila University in promoting learning and innovation within the academic community.

Ateneo de Manila University was named one of the top universities in the world for the study of four subjects, based on the latest QS World University Rankings by Subject.

item.title: Duterte tells of status quo: No movement, no materials for repair
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Duterte, status quo, South China Sea, construction materials, BRP Sierra Madre Summary: President Duterte emphasized maintaining the status quo in the South China Sea to prevent any actions that would disrupt the region, including the delivery of construction materials to the BRP Sierra Madre, a Philippine outpost. Duterte's directive aims to avoid escalating tensions in the disputed area. The President's stance underscores the importance of stability and peaceful coexistence among countries with claims in the South China Sea. Duterte's efforts prioritize maintaining the current situation and avoiding any provocative actions that could lead to further disputes or conflict. Maintaining the peace and stability in the region is crucial for all parties involved in the South China Sea territorial disputes.

Summary: Duterte stresses maintaining the status quo in the South China Sea to prevent disruptions, including halting the delivery of construction materials to the BRP Sierra Madre outpost. His directive aims to promote stability and peaceful coexistence among nations with claims in the region, prioritizing calm relations and avoiding provocations. This approach underscores the importance of a peaceful resolution and emphasizes the need to prevent actions that could escalate tensions or lead to conflicts in the disputed waters. Duterte's focus on maintaining the current situation highlights the significance of stability and cooperation in the South China Sea.

Duterte adverted to a status quo in which no country would make any move that would disrupt the South China Sea--including the bringing of construction materials to the BRP Sierra Madre.

item.title: Dumaguete diocese asks BBM to veto bill creating Negros Island Region
item.content:encoded:
Diocese of Dumaguete, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., veto, bill, Negros Island Region

The Diocese of Dumaguete has urged President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to veto the bill proposing the creation of the Negros Island Region (NIR). The diocese is concerned about the potential negative impact of the creation of the region on the unity and harmony of the people in the area. They believe that dividing the region may lead to discrimination and further divide the community. President Marcos Jr. is being asked to carefully consider the consequences of the bill and evaluate its potential effects on the residents of the area. The diocese is advocating for a unified approach that will promote peace and cooperation among the people of Negros Island. They hope that President Marcos Jr. will take their concerns into consideration before making a decision on the bill.

Summary:
Diocese of Dumaguete requests President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to veto the bill creating the Negros Island Region to prevent potential negative impacts on unity and harmony and promote peace and cooperation among the residents.

The Diocese of Dumaguete has asked President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to consider vetoing the bill that seeks to create the Negros Island Region or NIR.

item.title: PH, Japan talk enhanced ties ahead of trilateral summit with US
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, Japan, foreign affairs, secretary, relations Summary: The foreign affairs secretary and minister of the Philippines and Japan met in Washington, D.C. on Thursday to discuss further strengthening their relations. The meeting aimed to enhance collaboration and cooperation between the two countries. Both parties expressed their commitment to maintaining a strong partnership and working together on various issues of mutual interest. The discussions touched upon economic, security, and cultural cooperation, with a focus on enhancing trade and investment between the two nations. Overall, the meeting highlighted the importance of fostering strong diplomatic ties and collaboration between the Philippines and Japan.

Summary:

WASHINGTON, D.C. --The foreign affairs secretary and minister of the Philippines and Japan met here on Thursday as the countries sought to strengthen their relations even further moving forward.

item.title: Believers gather in Laoag for Niña Ruiz Abad
item.content:encoded:
Cathedral, Laoag City, believers, diocesan tribunal, beatification
Summary: The St. William Cathedral Church in Laoag City was filled with believers during the opening session of the diocesan tribunal for the proposed beatification and canonization of Niña Ruiz Abad from Sarrat, Ilocos Norte. The event drew a large crowd to witness the proceedings that could potentially lead to the declaration of Niña Ruiz Abad as a saint. The historical significance of Niña Ruiz Abad's life in Sarrat, Ilocos Norte, has captured the attention and devotion of many, prompting efforts for her beatification. The diocesan tribunal's decision on her case will determine whether she will be officially recognized as a saint in the Catholic Church. The atmosphere in the St. William Cathedral was one of reverence and anticipation as believers gathered to show their support for Niña Ruiz Abad's cause for sainthood.

The St. William Cathedral Church in Laoag City was filled with believers during the opening session of the diocesan tribunal for the proposed beatification and canonization of Niña Ruiz Abad from Sarrat, Ilocos Norte.

item.title: Davao del Norte gov suspended, cries harassment
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Office of the President, 60-day preventive suspension, Davao del Norte Governor Edwin Jubahib, administrative complaints, Department of Interior and Local Government (DILG) Summary: The Office of the President has issued a 60-day preventive suspension for Davao del Norte Governor Edwin Jubahib due to various administrative complaints, as confirmed by the Department of Interior and Local Government (DILG). This move is seen as a response to allegations of wrongdoing and misconduct on the part of the governor. The decision highlights the commitment of the government to uphold accountability and transparency in public service. Governor Jubahib's suspension is aimed at addressing the issues raised against him and ensuring a fair and impartial investigation. The DILG's intervention underscores the importance of holding public officials accountable for their actions. The suspension serves as a cautionary measure to deter future misconduct and promote good governance in the province. Overall, this development emphasizes the government's commitment to addressing allegations of corruption and malfeasance in local governance.

Summary:

The Office of the President has ordered the 60-day preventive suspension of Davao del Norte Governor Edwin Jubahib amid various administrative complaints, the Department of Interior and Local Government (DILG) said on Thursday.

item.title: Portugal's Catholic Church to compensate sexual abuse victims
item.content:encoded:
Catholic Church, Portugal, financial compensation, victims, child sexual abuse
Portugal's Catholic Church has announced that they will provide financial compensation to victims of child sexual abuse within the Church. The compensation amounts will be determined on a case-by-case basis. This decision is a step towards acknowledging and addressing the harm caused to victims and holding the Church accountable for the abuse that took place. The Church is taking responsibility for the actions of those within its institutions and is committed to providing support and reparations to the victims. This initiative reflects a commitment to transparency, accountability, and justice within the Church, as they work to address the longstanding issue of abuse within the institution.

Summary: The Catholic Church in Portugal will be providing financial compensation to victims of child sexual abuse within the Church, with amounts determined on a case-by-case basis. This decision demonstrates a commitment to acknowledging and addressing the harm caused to victims and holding the Church accountable for the abuse that occurred. The Church is taking responsibility for the actions of individuals within its institutions and is dedicated to providing support and reparations to those affected. This initiative reflects a dedication to transparency, accountability, and justice within the Church as they strive to address the issue of abuse within the institution.

Portugal's Catholic Church will financially compensate victims of child sexual abuse within the Church, setting the amounts to be paid on a case-by-case basis, it announced on Thursday.

item.title: EDSA busway violators with '7" and '8" protocol plates flee after being caught
item.content:encoded:
Senate, House of Representatives, protocol plates, EDSA busway, authorities

The cars with Senate and House of Representatives protocol plates were caught using the EDSA busway on Thursday morning. However, instead of complying with authorities, they fled the scene shortly after being intercepted. This incident raises concerns about the abuse of privileges by government officials and their blatant disregard for traffic rules. The drivers of these vehicles are expected to face consequences for their actions, as they have blatantly violated the laws and regulations governing public roads. The public is outraged by this display of arrogance and entitlement, as it highlights the disparity between the behavior of those in power and the average citizen. Such behavior undermines the authority of law enforcement and erodes public trust in government officials. Immediate action must be taken to hold these individuals accountable and prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.

Summary:

Cars with Senate and House of Representative protocol plates caught using the EDSA busway on Thursday morning fled from authorities shortly after they were caught.

item.content:encoded: Health professionals on Thursday said that using electric cigarettes or vape products is not a safer alternative to smoking for it may cause lung injury, especially among the youth.

item.title: Mexico calls for UN to suspend Ecuador until it apologizes for embassy raid
item.content:encoded:
Mexico, Ecuador, United Nations, suspension, apology Summary: Mexico is urging for Ecuador's suspension from the UN until an apology is made for a raid on Mexico's embassy in Quito. Perceiving the raid as a violation of international law, Mexico emphasized the need for Ecuador to acknowledge and apologize for the incident. This call for suspension is a decisive measure to hold Ecuador accountable for its actions and uphold diplomatic norms. The request serves as a strong message to Ecuador regarding the seriousness of the breach of diplomatic immunity and the importance of international relations. By calling for a public apology from Ecuador, Mexico is asserting the significance of respecting embassies as sovereign territories and ensuring protection under international law. The dispute underscores the necessity for countries to adhere to diplomatic protocols and avoid actions that could strain bilateral relations. Mexico's stance emphasizes the gravity of the situation and the need for Ecuador to address the issue promptly to prevent further escalation of tensions.

Mexico is calling for Ecuador to be suspended from the United Nations until the South American country issues a public apology for its raid on Mexico's embassy in Quito.

item.title: Comelec awards 2025 poll results transmission deal to joint venture
item.content:encoded:
Commission on Elections, Comelec, Secure Electronic Transmission Services, SETS project, iOne Resources Inc., Ardent Networks Inc. Summary: The Commission on Elections (Comelec) officially awarded the P1.4-billion Secure Electronic Transmission Services (SETS) project contract for the 2025 automated polls to the joint venture of iOne Resources Inc. and Ardent Networks Inc. This decision marks a significant milestone for the upcoming automated polls. With this partnership, Comelec aims to enhance the security and efficiency of the election process. The winning bid of the joint venture demonstrated their capabilities and commitment to providing reliable electronic transmission services. This development underscores the importance of investing in technology for electoral processes to ensure transparency and credibility. Overall, the awarding of the SETS project contract reflects Comelec's dedication to modernizing voting systems and upholding democratic principles.

Summary:

The Commission on Elections (Comelec) on Thursday officially awarded the P1.4-billion Secure Electronic Transmission Services (SETS) project contract for the 2025 automated polls to the winning bidder --the joint venture of iOne Resources Inc. and Ardent Networks, Inc.

item.title: Robredo's Angat Buhay eyes tie-up with gov't for free mental health services
item.content:encoded:
Leni Robredo, Vice President, mental health services, government, collaboration Summary: Leni Robredo, the former Vice President, has expressed her willingness to collaborate with the government in addressing the increasing demand for free and accessible mental health services. This partnership aims to provide much-needed support and resources to individuals struggling with mental health issues. Robredo's openness to working with the government reflects a proactive approach towards prioritizing mental health and well-being in society. By combining efforts, they can work towards improving access to mental health services and creating a more supportive environment for those in need. This collaboration has the potential to make a significant impact on the mental health landscape in the Philippines, by reaching a wider population and offering essential services to those who require them. Such partnerships can lead to positive outcomes and contribute to the overall improvement of mental health services in the country.

Summary:

Former Vice President Leni Robredo on Thursday expressed openness to work with the government to address the growing demand for free and accessible mental health services.

item.title: LTFRB to offer Libreng Sakay during 2-day transport strike
item.content:encoded:
LTFRB, Libreng Sakay, transport strike, April 15-16, affected
Summary:
The Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) announced that it will provide free rides (Libreng Sakay) to individuals impacted by the upcoming two-day transport strike scheduled for April 15-16. This initiative aims to assist commuters who may experience difficulty in reaching their destinations during the strike. The LTFRB's offer of Libreng Sakay is a proactive measure to alleviate the inconvenience caused by the planned protest and ensure that affected individuals have access to alternative transportation options. The free rides will help minimize disruption and enable people to carry on with their daily activities despite the transport strike. It demonstrates the LTFRB's commitment to addressing the concerns of the public and mitigating the impact of the strike on commuters.

The Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) on Thursday said it would offer Libreng Sakay to those who will be affected by the two-day transport strike on April 15-16.

item.title: DOH warns vs contaminated halo-halo this summer
item.content:encoded:
Department of Health, Filipinos, summer, dessert, halo-halo
The Department of Health warns Filipinos to be cautious when consuming the popular Filipino dessert halo-halo during the summer to avoid contamination. As temperatures rise, many people seek refreshing treats to beat the heat. However, the DOH urges the public to be vigilant as halo-halo can easily become contaminated, leading to potential health risks. With its mix of various ingredients like fruits, beans, and shaved ice, proper handling and preparation are essential to prevent foodborne illnesses. It's important for individuals to be aware of the potential dangers of consuming halo-halo from unhygienic sources. By taking precautions and practicing food safety measures, Filipinos can still enjoy this beloved dessert while staying safe and healthy.

Summary: The Department of Health is cautioning Filipinos about the risks of consuming halo-halo during the summer months. As a popular dessert choice to beat the heat, halo-halo's mix of ingredients makes it susceptible to contamination. Proper handling and preparation are crucial to avoid foodborne illnesses. By being aware of potential risks and practicing food safety measures, Filipinos can safely enjoy halo-halo while staying healthy.

Now that it's summertime, Filipinos tend to indulge in cool, refreshing treats to beat the heat. The Department of Health (DOH), however, said the public should take caution before scooping up and savoring the popular Filipino dessert halo-halo as it could get easily contaminated.

item.title: Biik na nagbababad sa batya para maibsan ang init, kinaaliwan ng netizens
item.content:encoded:
Palanggana, Biik, Netizens, Tabogon, Cebu Summary: A pig enjoying a relaxing time in a basin to cool off from the heat in Tabogon, Cebu has garnered attention and love from netizens. The image of the pig lounging in the water has gone viral online, with many people finding the sight adorable and heartwarming. The pig's leisurely behavior provides a sense of relaxation and comfort, reflecting the care and attention given to animals by their owners. The viral post serves as a reminder of the importance of providing animals with a comfortable environment and showing them love and care. Overall, the widespread appreciation for the pig's contentment highlights the positive impact that animal welfare and compassion can have on social media users.

Kinagiliwan ng netizens ang isang biik na relax na nagbabad sa isang palanggana para maibsan ang nararamdaman nitong init sa Tabogon, Cebu.

item.title: Heatwaves put millions of children in Asia at risk --UNICEF
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: children, vulnerable, climate change, heat, threat Summary: Children are more vulnerable to the effects of climate change compared to adults. Excess heat, in particular, poses a potentially lethal threat to children. UNICEF official Debora Comini emphasized the importance of recognizing the heightened risk faced by children in the face of climate-related challenges. It is crucial to prioritize the protection of children and implement measures to mitigate the impact of heatwaves and other climate change-related dangers on their health and well-being. By acknowledging the specific vulnerabilities of children and taking proactive steps to address them, we can ensure their safety and resilience in the face of environmental challenges and contribute to building a more sustainable and secure future for the younger generations.

Summary:

"Children are more vulnerable than adults to the effects of climate change, and excess heat is a potentially lethal threat to them," said UNICEF official Debora Comini.

item.title: DBP extends P3-B loan to Mandaue for new city hall
item.content:encoded:
loan, Development Bank of the Philippines (DBP), Mandaue City, construction, new city hall
Development Bank of the Philippines (DBP) has approved a P3-billion loan to the local government unit (LGU) of Mandaue City for the construction of a new city hall. The loan will be used to fund the development of the new city hall, which is expected to provide better facilities for the residents of Mandaue City. The project aims to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the local government's services by providing a modern and functional working space for city officials and employees. This initiative is part of DBP's commitment to support local governments in their infrastructure development projects, helping them to improve their services and promote economic growth in their communities. The loan agreement between DBP and Mandaue City signals a positive step towards enhancing public infrastructure and services in the city, ultimately benefiting its residents and stakeholders.

Summary:

State-owned Development Bank of the Philippines (DBP) said Thursday it has extended a P3-billion loan to the local government unit (LGU) of Mandaue City for the construction of a new city hall.

item.title: DOH eyes DepEd's help to warn youth vs health risks of vaping
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Health Secretary, Ted Herbosa, Department of Education, youth, e-cigarettes Summary: Health Secretary Ted Herbosa plans to collaborate with the Department of Education to educate young people about the health risks associated with vaping or using e-cigarettes. Recognizing the increasing popularity of these products among the youth, he aims to raise awareness and promote informed decision-making. By involving DepEd in this initiative, they can reach a wider audience and incorporate relevant information into the educational curriculum. The partnership will not only focus on raising awareness but also on providing accurate and evidence-based information to enable young people to make educated choices regarding their health. Collaboration between the health and education sectors is essential in addressing the growing concern surrounding the use of e-cigarettes and vaping products among the youth, ensuring that they are well-informed about the risks involved. This joint effort emphasizes the importance of addressing public health issues through comprehensive education and awareness programs.

Summary: Health Secretary Ted Herbosa intends to collaborate with the Department of Education to educate the youth about the health risks of using e-cigarettes. By involving DepEd in this initiative, they aim to reach a wider audience and integrate relevant information into the educational curriculum. The partnership will focus on raising awareness, providing evidence-based information, and promoting informed decision-making to empower young people in making choices regarding their health. This collaboration highlights the importance of addressing public health concerns through joint efforts between the health and education sectors.

Health Secretary Ted Herbosa said Thursday that he would ask the Department of Education (DepEd) to assist in educating the youth about the health risks of using e-cigarettes or vaping products.

item.title: Authorities checking possible locations for Quiboloy -- PNP
item.content:encoded: Authorities are looking at possible locations for Kingdom of Jesus Christ leader Apollo Quiboloy after there was no sign of him at his Davao City and Samal Island properties, the Philippine National Police said Thursday.

item.title: Workers have right to 'heat breaks" -- DOH
item.content:encoded:
heat, country, Health Secretary, workers, importance Summary: Health Secretary Ted Herbosa emphasized the significance of providing heat breaks to workers amidst the intense heat in the country. Herbosa's statement highlights the growing concern for worker safety and health in challenging weather conditions. As the heatwave continues to affect various regions, employers should implement measures to protect their employees from heat-related illnesses and exhaustion. Providing regular breaks and access to cool environments can help prevent heat-related incidents and promote a healthier work environment overall. Herbosa's call for ensuring heat breaks for workers reflects the government's commitment to safeguarding the health and safety of all individuals in the workforce.

Summary:

Amid the severe heat being experienced in the country, Health Secretary Ted Herbosa on Thursday underscored the importance of giving heat breaks to workers.

item.title: PNP to be stricter vs. illegal wang-wang use after Marcos order
item.content:encoded:
keywords: Philippine National Police, stricter enforcement, rules, sirens, blinkers Summary: The Philippine National Police (PNP) announced plans for stricter enforcement of regulations on the use of sirens, blinkers, and similar devices. They stated that they will be cracking down on misuse of these devices to ensure compliance with road safety regulations. The PNP emphasized the importance of following the rules and regulations set in place to maintain order on the roads. This move aims to promote responsible driving practices and prevent abuse of emergency vehicle signals for personal convenience. The PNP's decision reflects their commitment to upholding traffic laws and ensuring a safer environment for all road users.202

Summary: Philippine National Police to enforce rules on sirens and blinkers more strictly to prevent abuse and promote road safety. Compliance with regulations is crucial to maintain order and prevent misuse of emergency signals. The PNP's initiative aims to encourage responsible driving practices and deter individuals from using these devices for personal convenience. This decision underscores the PNP's dedication to upholding traffic laws and creating a safer road environment for all users.

The Philippine National Police (PNP) on Thursday said it will be stricter in enforcing rules and regulations regarding the use of sirens, blinkers, and other similar devices.

item.title: Batang babae na dinukot umano, natagpuang duguan sa damuhan at posibleng ginahasa
item.content:encoded:
kidnapping, girl, assaulted, General Santos City, naked

A young girl was reportedly abducted and found in a grassy area in General Santos City without any upper clothing and with signs of being sexually assaulted. The victim, whose identity was not disclosed, was discovered with visible signs of violence indicating that she had been raped. Local authorities are conducting an investigation into the incident to identify the perpetrators and bring them to justice. The disturbing case highlights the urgent need for heightened security measures to protect vulnerable individuals, especially young children, from falling victim to such heinous crimes. The community is urged to remain vigilant and report any suspicious activities to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. Enforcing stricter laws and implementing effective preventive measures are essential in safeguarding the welfare and safety of all residents, particularly the most defenseless members of society.
Summary: - young girl abducted in General Santos City - found naked in a grassy area - signs of sexual assault - authorities investigating the incident - community urged to report suspicious activities to prevent similar crimes

Isang batang babae na dinukot umano ang nakitang walang damit pang itaas at duguan sa isang damuhan sa General Santos City. Ang biktima, nakitaan ng senyales na ginahasa.

item.title: 11-anyos na babae na 'di nakasunod sa utos, sinaktan umano ng ina at mga tiyuhin
item.content:encoded: Isang 11-anyos na batang babae ang sinaktan at ipinasok pa umano sa kulungan ng baboy ng kaniyang ina at mga tiyuhin nang hindi niya masunod ang utos nito sa Talisay, Negros Occidental.

item.title: Lalaki, arestado sa panggagahasa umano sa menor de edad niyang pinsan sa Maynila

item.title: DOH: 6 million doses of pertussis vaccine to arrive in July
item.content:encoded: Six million doses of the pentavalent vaccine that could protect against pertussis and other diseases are expected to arrive in the country by July, the Department of Health said Thursday.

item.title: PH trade deficit declined 6% in Feb 2024
item.content:encoded: The Philippines' balance of trade in goods deficit stood at $3.647 billion in February, which was a 6% decrease from $3.88 billion in February 2023.

item.title: Viral na paghawak ng 2 lalaki sa mga tarsier sa South Cotabato, iniimbestigahan
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: DENR, investigation, tarsier, Polomok, South Cotabato Summary: The Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) is conducting an investigation regarding the handling of two tarsiers in Polomok, South Cotabato by two men, which sparked backlash on social media. The incident raised concerns about the welfare and protection of these endangered primates. The DENR is likely looking into any possible violations of wildlife protection laws and regulations in this case. It is important for authorities to ensure the proper treatment and conservation of tarsiers and other wildlife species to prevent further harm or exploitation. The public outcry on social media highlights the importance of raising awareness about the protection of endangered animals and the consequences of illegal wildlife trafficking. It is crucial for responsible authorities to take swift action to address such incidents and enforce stricter measures to safeguard the wildlife in the region. The outcome of the investigation will determine the necessary actions to be taken to prevent similar incidents from happening in the future.

Summary: The Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) is investigating the handling of tarsiers in Polomok, South Cotabato by two men, following social media backlash. Concerns on wildlife protection and conservation are raised, necessitating scrutiny of possible violations of wildlife protection laws. Authorities must ensure the proper treatment and conservation of tarsiers to prevent further harm or exploitation. Public outcry emphasizes the need for awareness on protecting endangered animals and the repercussions of illegal wildlife trafficking. Immediate action and stricter measures by authorities are crucial to safeguard wildlife in the region and prevent similar incidents. The investigation's findings will determine necessary steps to prevent future occurrences.

Nagsasagawa ng imbestigasyon ang Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) kaugnay ng paghawak ng dalawang lalaki sa mga tarsier sa Polomok, South Cotabato na umani ng batikos sa social media.

item.title: Pasig court denies Quiboloy's motion to hold issuance of arrest warrant
item.content:encoded:
court, Kingdom of Jesus Christ, Apollo Quiboloy, human trafficking, warrant of arrest Summary: A Pasig City court has denied Apollo Quiboloy's motion to defer proceedings related to human trafficking charges filed against him by the Kingdom of Jesus Christ. The court refused to hold back the issuance of a warrant of arrest, indicating that the case will proceed as scheduled. Quiboloy, the leader of the KOJC, faces non-bailable charges of qualified human trafficking. This ruling suggests that the court is not inclined to delay the legal process and is taking the allegations seriously. The decision underscores the gravity of the charges against Quiboloy and the significance of ensuring due process in such cases. These developments indicate that the legal system is moving forward in holding accountable those accused of involvement in human trafficking activities. Quiboloy's legal team will need to prepare a defense against the charges as the case progresses through the court system.

A Pasig City court has denied Kingdom of Jesus Christ (KOJC) leader Apollo Quiboloy's motion to defer or suspend proceedings and hold in abeyance the issuance of a warrant of arrest in relation to the non-bailable qualified human trafficking charges filed against him.

item.title: DepEd: Over 5K schools suspend F2F classes due to severe heat
item.content:encoded:
schools, nationwide, suspended, in-person classes, alternative delivery modes Summary:
- A total of 5,844 schools across the nation have suspended in-person classes due to the intense heat.
- Instead of traditional classes, these schools have transitioned to alternative delivery methods to ensure the safety and well-being of students.
- The Department of Education (DepEd) announced the shift, emphasizing the importance of protecting students from extreme temperatures.
- With the ongoing heatwave affecting various regions, these schools are taking proactive measures to safeguard their students.
- This move highlights the adaptability and resilience of the education sector in addressing challenges and providing continuous learning opportunities for students.
Summary:

A total of 5,844 schools nationwide have now suspended in-person classes and shifted to alternative delivery modes amid the scorching heat, the Department of Education (DepEd) said Thursday.

item.title: Magnitude 5.1 earthquake jolts Davao de Oro town
item.content:encoded: A magnitude 5.1 earthquake was reported in New Bataan in Davao de Oro shortly before noon on Thursday, PHIVOLCS said.

item.title: Makati LGU vows relentless drug ops after seizure of P3.5-M drugs in Q1 2024
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Makati City, local government, anti-drug campaign, illegal drugs, seizure
Summary: The local government of Makati City is committed to continuing its anti-drug campaign, with the city police seizing nearly P3.5 million worth of illegal drugs in the first quarter of 2024. This significant seizure highlights the ongoing efforts of the authorities in combating drug trafficking and abuse in the city. The local government's dedication to eradicating the drug problem demonstrates a proactive approach in ensuring the safety and well-being of its residents. The successful operation by the city police underscores the effectiveness of the anti-drug measures in place and the cooperation between law enforcement agencies and the community. This relentless pursuit of drug offenders sends a strong message that illegal drug activities will not be tolerated in Makati City. Through continued vigilance and enforcement actions, the local government remains resolute in its commitment to upholding the law and maintaining a drug-free environment for its citizens.

Summary:

The local government of Makati City on Thursday vowed to continue its anti-drug campaign after the city police seized nearly P3.5 million worth of illegal drugs in the first quarter of 2024.

item.title: MANIBELA, PISTON to hold 2-day transport strike starting April 15
item.content:encoded:
transport, groups, PISTON, MANIBELA, nationwide

Transport groups PISTON and MANIBELA have announced plans for a nationwide transport strike next week in response to the approaching deadline for the consolidation of PUV drivers and operators. The strike is aimed at protesting the implementation of the government's policies related to the transportation sector. Both PISTON and MANIBELA are seeking to voice their concerns and opposition to the consolidation requirement that is set to take effect soon. The transport strike is expected to disrupt public transportation services across the country and could potentially cause inconvenience to commuters. This move highlights the ongoing tensions between transport groups and the government over regulations and policies affecting the industry. The announcement of the strike reflects the growing unrest and dissatisfaction among PUV drivers and operators regarding the consolidation process. The nationwide strike is a coordinated effort by PISTON and MANIBELA to demonstrate unity and solidarity in their opposition to the government's directives.

Summary:

Transport groups PISTON and MANIBELA on Thursday announced that they would hold a nationwide transport strike next week amid the looming deadline for consolidation of PUV drivers and operators.

item.title: Bipartisan US bill seeks $2.5B for PH defense capabilities
item.content:encoded:
Senators, bipartisan bill, Philippines, $2.5 billion, Chinese pressure
Two US senators introduced a bipartisan bill to provide the Philippines with $2.5 billion for defense against Chinese pressure on the eve of a trilateral summit. The bill aims to enhance Manila's defenses and strengthen its security cooperation with the US and Japan. This move comes amidst growing tensions in the South China Sea, where Beijing has been asserting its territorial claims. The funding would enable the Philippines to acquire advanced military equipment and enhance its capabilities to deter aggression in the region. The bill highlights the US commitment to supporting its allies in the Indo-Pacific region and countering China's aggressive actions. Additionally, it underscores the importance of trilateral cooperation among the US, Japan, and the Philippines to uphold peace and stability in the region.

Summary: - Senators introduced a bipartisan bill to provide the Philippines with $2.5 billion for defense against Chinese pressure. - The bill aims to enhance Manila's defenses and strengthen security cooperation with the US and Japan. - The funding would enable the Philippines to acquire advanced military equipment to deter aggression in the region. - The move highlights the US commitment to supporting allies in the Indo-Pacific region and countering China's actions. - Trilateral cooperation among the US, Japan, and the Philippines is crucial for maintaining peace and stability in the region.

WASHINGTON -- On the eve of a trilateral summit between the United States, Japan and the Philippines, two prominent US senators on Wednesday introduced a bipartisan bill to provide Manila with $2.5 billion to boost its defenses against Chinese pressure.

item.title: Marcos wants regulated issuance of protocol license plates
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President, Ferdinand Marcos Jr., regulation, issuance, protocol license plates Summary: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has issued a directive for the regulation of the issuance of protocol license plates to government officials. This new regulation is aimed at ensuring a more organized and accountable system for the distribution of these specialized license plates. By implementing stricter guidelines and oversight, President Marcos Jr. hopes to prevent abuse and misuse of protocol plates by individuals in government positions. The directive will streamline the process for obtaining these plates and help in identifying legitimate users. This move reflects the government's commitment to transparency and accountability in the use of official privileges and resources. President Marcos Jr.'s decision to regulate protocol license plates underscores the importance of upholding standards and ethics within the government sector. This initiative is expected to promote integrity and responsible usage among government officials who are granted this privilege.

Summary: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has directed the regulation of the issuance of protocol license plates to government officials in order to establish a more organized and accountable system, prevent abuse, streamline the process, and uphold standards of integrity and ethics.

President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. directed the regulation of the issuance of protocol license plates to government officials.

item.title: 2 dead in Navy chopper mishap near Cavite City market
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Navy, pilots, killed, helicopter crash, Cavite City Summary: Two pilots from the Philippine Navy lost their lives in a tragic helicopter crash during a training session near a public market in Cavite City. The incident occurred on Thursday morning and was confirmed by the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP). The training helicopter crashed, resulting in the fatalities of both pilots. The cause of the crash is currently under investigation. The AFP expressed condolences to the families of the deceased pilots and assured that a thorough investigation will be conducted to determine the circumstances surrounding the accident. The tragic event serves as a reminder of the risks involved in military training operations and highlights the sacrifices made by service members in the line of duty.

Summary:

Two pilots were killed after a training helicopter of the Philippine Navy crashed near a public market in Cavite City on Thursday morning, according to the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP).

item.title: Marcos arrives in Washington for summit with US, Japan
item.content:encoded:
Joint Base Andrews Airport, President Marcos, trilateral meeting, Japan, US Summary: President Marcos arrived at Joint Base Andrews Airport for a trilateral meeting with Japan and the US on Thursday morning. This meeting signifies a significant diplomatic effort to strengthen relationships and cooperation between the three nations. The discussions likely focused on important economic, security, and political issues impacting the Asia-Pacific region. Japan's presence underscores the importance of regional stability and security in the face of various challenges. The meeting may also touch on shared interests such as trade, defense, and countering global threats. Overall, this gathering highlights the commitment of all parties to work together towards common goals and objectives in the international arena.

President Marcos arrived at the Joint Base Andrews Airport here on Thursday morning (Philippine time) for his trilateral meeting with Japan and the US.

item.title: Marcos bans gov't officials from using sirens, blinkers
item.content:encoded:
prohibited, government officials, personnel, sirens, blinkers Summary: President Ferdinand Marcos issued a directive forbidding government officials and personnel from utilizing sirens and blinkers on their vehicles. This decision aimed to curb abuse of authority and privilege, ensuring that public servants do not exploit their positions for personal convenience or travel shortcuts. By prohibiting the use of sirens and blinkers, Marcos sought to promote accountability and equality among all citizens, emphasizing that government officials should abide by the same traffic rules as regular individuals. This measure was intended to enhance public perception of government officials and promote a more egalitarian society where officials are held to the same standards as the general population. The directive underscored Marcos' commitment to enforcing discipline and ethical conduct within the government, signaling a stance against privileged treatment and elitism among public servants.

President Ferdinand Marcos prohibited government officials and personnel from using sirens, blinkers

item.title: North Korea leader Kim Jong Un says now is the time to be ready for war -- KCNA
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: North Korea, Kim Jong Un, military university, war, geopolitical situations Summary: Kim Jong Un, the North Korean leader, emphasized the need for heightened military preparedness, citing the uncertain geopolitical environment surrounding his country. During a visit to the main military university, he stated that the current instability necessitates a state of heightened readiness for war. This directive reflects his concerns about potential threats to North Korea's security. Kim Jong Un's comments reinforce the regime's focus on maintaining a strong military posture in the face of external pressures. The leader's visit to the military institution signals a commitment to prioritizing military capabilities and readiness in the current global context. His remarks underscore the importance of vigilance and readiness in responding to potential conflict scenarios. As tensions persist in the region, North Korea remains focused on bolstering its military strength to ensure its security and sovereignty.

Summary:

North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said unstable geopolitical situations surrounding his country mean now is the time to be more prepared for war than ever, as he inspected the country's main military university, KCNA news agency said on Thursday.

item.title: US assures deeper relations with PH under Biden
item.content:encoded: The United States has assured that it will continue to deepen its relations with the Philippines should President Joe Biden continue to lead the world"s most powerful country, amid the ongoing issues in the South China Sea.

item.title: PH hopes for trilateral trade agreement with US, Japan
item.content:encoded: The Philippines is hoping to have a trade agreement with Japan and the United States, as leaders of the three countries are set to hold a trilateral summit here Thursday.

item.title: US Security Adviser says no need for Beijing to 'overreact" to South China Sea row
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: China, South China Sea, tensions, Philippines, White House National Security adviser Summary: White House National Security adviser John Kirby stated that China should not overreact to the current situation in the South China Sea despite tensions with countries like the Philippines. Kirby emphasized the importance of maintaining calm and not escalating the situation further. He highlighted the need for diplomatic solutions and peaceful negotiations to address any disputes in the region. Kirby's remarks suggest a diplomatic approach to resolving conflicts and avoiding unnecessary escalations. It is crucial for all parties involved to exercise restraint and work towards peaceful resolutions to avoid any potential conflicts in the South China Sea. Diplomacy and dialogue are essential in managing tensions and fostering stability in the region. Kirby's comments reflect the United States' stance on the South China Sea issue and the importance of upholding international laws and norms in maritime disputes.

Summary:

There is no need for China to overreact to the current situation in the South China Sea amid the ongoing tensions with countries such as the Philippines, White House National Security adviser John Kirby said.

item.title: Heat stroke seen as man found dead in Ilocos Sur
item.content:encoded:
75-year-old man, heat stroke, found dead, Ilocos Sur, elderly Summary: A 75-year-old man was tragically found dead in Ilocos Sur, the victim of a fatal heat stroke. The elderly individual likely succumbed to the extreme heat in the region, highlighting the dangers of heat-related illnesses, especially for vulnerable populations such as seniors. The incident serves as a stark reminder of the importance of staying cool and hydrated during periods of intense heat, particularly for older individuals who may be more susceptible to such medical emergencies. Authorities are urging the public to take precautions and be mindful of the risks associated with high temperatures, emphasizing the need to check on elderly relatives and neighbors to ensure their well-being during heatwaves. The tragic death of the man underscores the necessity of awareness and preventative measures to avoid heat-related fatalities, particularly in areas prone to extreme weather conditions.

A 75-year-old man was found dead due to a heat stroke in Ilocos Sur.

item.title: US and Japan vow new security collaboration
item.content:encoded:
promised, strategic cooperation, co-development, manned moon landings, China

U.S. President Joe Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida vowed to usher in a "new era" of strategic cooperation between their countries. They discussed joint projects, including the co-development of missiles and plans for manned moon landings. The leaders also expressed concern over China's aggressive actions in the region, condemning their behavior. They emphasized the importance of strengthening their alliance to maintain peace and stability in the Indo-Pacific region. Biden and Kishida highlighted the need for closer collaboration on various fronts, from security and technology to economic and environmental issues. The discussions underscored the shared values and objectives of the U.S. and Japan, paving the way for enhanced cooperation in the future.

Summary:

U.S. President Joe Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida promised a "new era" of U.S.-Japan strategic cooperation on Wednesday, laying out a series of projects from co-development of missiles to manned moon landings, while condemning China's escalatory behavior in the region.

item.title: Two motorcycle riders killed after hitting post in Pampanga
item.content:encoded:
motorcycle, killed, post, Candaba, Pampanga Summary: Two individuals lost their lives in a tragic accident in Candaba, Pampanga when the motorcycle they were riding collided with a post. The impact of the crash resulted in the deaths of both riders. The incident serves as a grim reminder of the dangers of reckless driving and the importance of adhering to road safety regulations. The identities of the victims and the circumstances surrounding the accident have not yet been disclosed. Authorities are conducting an investigation to determine the cause of the crash and to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. The community is urged to exercise caution and vigilance on the roads to avoid such tragic accidents.

Two persons on a motorcycle were killed after they hit a post in Candaba, Pampanga.

item.title: Magnitude 5.1 quake hits off the coast of Dolores, Eastern Samar
item.content:encoded:
earthquake, magnitude 5.1, southeast Dolores, Eastern Samar, PHIVOLCS

An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.1 struck off the coast of southeast Dolores in Eastern Samar early on Thursday morning, according to PHIVOLCS. The seismic event was felt in the region, prompting concerns about potential damage and aftershocks. Thankfully, there were no immediate reports of casualties or significant destruction. PHIVOLCS continues to monitor the situation closely to assess any impact on the area and provide necessary assistance to affected communities. The earthquake serves as a reminder of the seismic activity that can occur in the region and the importance of preparedness for such natural events. Residents are advised to stay alert and follow safety protocols in the event of any future tremors. The resilience of the local population and quick response from authorities are crucial in mitigating the effects of earthquakes and ensuring the well-being of all individuals in the area.

Summary:

A magnitude 5.1 earthquake hits off the coast of southeast Dolores, Eastern Samar early Thursday morning, PHIVOLCS reported.

item.title: US investigators interview ship personnel in Baltimore bridge collapse
item.content:encoded: US National Transportation Safety Board chair Jennifer Homendy said that investigators have conducted interviews with cargo ship personnel over the March 26 Baltimore bridge collapse.

item.title: Thousands celebrate Eid'l Fitr

item.title: Isa na namang motorsiklo, nagawang makapag-counterflow sa Skyway sa Balintawak
item.content:encoded: Isang buwan makaraang masawi ang isang rider matapos na bumangga sa isang sasakyan nang mag-counterflow sa Skyway sa Baliktawak, isa na namang motorsiklo ang nakalusot at nakapag-counterflow sa naturang expressway.

item.content:encoded: The Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) is investigating the two men who went viral online after they caught two tarsiers in South Cotabato.

item.title: Motorsiklo na 3 ang sakay, sumalpok sa poste ng kuryente sa Pampanga; 2, patay
item.content:encoded:
two, dead, injured, motorcycle, accident Summary: Two individuals were killed and one person was injured in a motorcycle accident in Candaba, Pampanga. The incident occurred when the motorcycle they were riding collided with an electric post. The impact of the crash resulted in the immediate deaths of two individuals, while the third person sustained injuries and was taken to the hospital for treatment. The exact cause of the accident is yet to be determined, and authorities are conducting an investigation into the circumstances that led to the tragic incident. The identities of the victims have not been disclosed, and their families are being informed of the unfortunate event. Local officials are reminding the public to practice caution and observe traffic regulations to prevent similar accidents from occurring in the future.

Summary:

Dalawa ang patay, at sugatan ang isa pa nang sumalpok sa poste ng kuryente ang sinasakyan nilang motorsiklo sa Candaba, Pampanga.

item.title: Motorcycle counterflow along Skyway caught on camera
item.content:encoded:
motorcycle rider, counterflowing, Balintawak exit, Skyway, Joseph Morong Summary: A motorcycle rider was caught counterflowing at the Balintawak exit of the Skyway, as reported by Joseph Morong on "24 Oras." The incident involved the rider going against the flow of traffic, which is a dangerous and illegal maneuver. This action not only puts the rider at risk but also endangers other road users. The report highlights the importance of following traffic rules and regulations to ensure the safety of everyone on the road. The rider's reckless behavior serves as a reminder of the consequences of violating traffic laws and the potential harm it can cause. The news report serves as a warning to all motorists to adhere to traffic laws and prioritize safety while on the road.

A motorcycle rider was caught counterflowing at the Balintawak exit of the Skyway, according to Joseph Morong"s report on "24 Oras."

item.title: PUP Open University offers 'study at home" program for parents
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Polytechnic University of the Philippines, Open University System, parents, tertiary education, home Summary: The Polytechnic University of the Philippines Open University System (PUP OUS) is providing parents with the opportunity to pursue higher education from the comfort of their homes. This initiative allows parents to continue their tertiary education while balancing their responsibilities at home. The program offers flexibility and convenience, enabling parents to study at their own pace and schedule. By offering distance learning options, PUP OUS ensures that parents have access to quality education without the need to physically attend classes on campus. This innovative approach to education empowers parents to further their academic pursuits while fulfilling their obligations to their families. PUP OUS's commitment to providing accessible education to all learners, including parents, demonstrates its dedication to promoting lifelong learning opportunities in the Philippines.

Summary: The Polytechnic University of the Philippines Open University System is offering parents the chance to pursue tertiary education from home, providing flexibility and convenience through distance learning options. This initiative enables parents to balance their academic pursuits with their family responsibilities, ensuring access to quality education for all learners.

The Polytechnic University of the Philippines Open University System ( PUP OUS) is offering parents the opportunity to pursue tertiary education by studying at home.

item.title: Hopes fade for workers missing in Italy hydro plant blast
item.content:encoded: Hopes of finding survivors of an accident at a power plant in northern Italy are dwindling, firefighters said on Wednesday, as rescuers searched for four people missing in an area of the plant where water was rising rapidly.

item.title: May kababalaghan nga ba sa 'Devil"s Corner" sa Marilaque Highway?
